text: This small branch of the New Black has the same set-up as the other branch so there are numerous roasters from around the world to select from and the coffees are made on the steampunk. The quality here is as good as in the other location but it is clearly mainly for the people working in Centennial tower as there is not a single seat here and there is also no real clear signs anywhere as to where it is (it is at the entrance of Centennial Tower) but still a good place to pick up a coffee if you are shopping in the mall next door.<br><br>Staff are also friendly and if you come outside the morning or lunch rush they usually have a lot time to chat about the coffees and they also showed my the settings on the steampunk and how to adjust and make the coffees. It does not get much better as a take away coffee place.

Ya Kun Kaya makes some of the best kaya that I&#39;ve had. I always have to stop by and pick up a few jars before leaving Singapore. They make for great gifts, and my friends always ask me to bring some back with me when I visit. This location is within the Food Village in Takashimaya SC.

text: My favorite coffee in Singapore! Coffee is prepared for each individual cup. Great flavor &amp; aroma! They&#39;re busy but staff is efficient. Located in the Food Village of Takashimaya SC.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/I6qakBvwTg_-soVU-eEeIQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ten-cafe-singapore?reviewid=i7NrevWiPhGQHm3L3QFbUw&select=I6qakBvwTg_-soVU-eEeIQ', 'altText': 'Photo of TEN Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Entrance to the cafe', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Entrance to the cafe'}]
text: This place is mostly for office-goers around the Harbourfront Towers and the cafe is open from Monday to Friday 7:30 AM to 6:30 PM and closed on Sat/Sun/PH. <br>The usual Tea/Coffee are available along with soft drinks. Breakfast features Bee Hoon Noodles, Pau and a wide assortment of sandwiches containing Tuna, Egg-Mayo, Salami or a combinations of these with either Brown bread or regular bread. <br>There&#39;s sitting place also although most people take-away breakfast and drinks before going to office. <br>The Quality is good. Although a little pricey, but quite convenient as it&#39;s the nearest place for Harbourfront Towers people for snacks.

That Coffee C was crack!!!  It was our first day in Singapore and we were roaming around the hawker stalls in Chinatown.  Needless to say, I was told by one of my buddies to try Coffee C.  We saw this line around a small hawker stand - not for food, but for coffee and tea!  We needed a pick-me up, so we stood in line with everyone else!  They were doing that cool pulled coffee thing as part of it&#39;s preparation - I don&#39;t really know if it has purpose to add flavor or aerate the coffee, but it&#39;s definitely cool to watch.  It was also a bargain at 1.10 SGD (basically less than 1 USD)!  There were other offerings (tea, sugar cane juice, bread), but we just needed that Coffee C and in one sip, I was hooked!

Calamansi (Singapore limited edition)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Calamansi (Singapore limited edition)'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kELWb0jHEc9m281kTthA3g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lupicia-singapore?reviewid=G-ATihvVuNb_v-o57aE_fQ&select=kELWb0jHEc9m281kTthA3g', 'altText': 'Photo of Lupicia - Singapore, Singapore. Fan Dance (chinese new year edition)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Fan Dance (chinese new year edition)'}]
text: Singapore limited edition tea: Calamansi (best served cold)<br><br>I&#39;ve been to almost all of the Lupicia tea shops (except Taiwan, Australia, and a few stores in Japan). This one in Singapore is inside the Great City Mall! It&#39;s a bit small compared to the Paris and Honolulu ones! But the staff was really helpful and friendly as always! I sampled the Calamansi tea since it&#39;s the only one you can get at the Singapore Lupicia! It was like drinking hot lime tea! lol! The staff recommended serving it cold like an iced tea! I bought a tin of the Calamansi and a box of the Fan Dance (Chinese New Year edition) all for about $29USD!<br><br>If you&#39;re into finding exclusive Lupicia teas, I also recommend visiting the Isetan Drymarket on Scotts Road. The store is a bit hidden on the Sports Level. But they have exclusive Lupicia teas (Spice Garden, Durian Green, Miss Vanda, Royal Bandung) made just for Isetan Singapore!!! A neat find! :)

text: This is the new kid on the block. This quaint little cafe is located directly opposite Tiong Bahru market along a row of shophouses. It gives everyone a healthy option offering raw, gluten free, sugar free, MSG free,  confectionery items.<br><br>Upon entering, on the left you are faced with their counter of cakes &amp; quiches, followed by the ice cream section and coffee maker. <br><br>On the right are some shelves displaying their chia seeds, raw honey, organic maple syrup, coffee beans, and even an old film camera. They are also carrying Keep Cups of various designs and colours.<br><br>The seating area is right inside on the right. There are 2 big long wooden tables for larger groups. These tables are sometimes used for their workshops as well. Further in at the back at a few smaller 4 seater wooden tables. Facing the long wooden tables there are glass panels where you can peek into the preparation and baking area where you can see the staff going about making the various food items.<br><br>Immediately after this area is a small swing door on the left that leads to the washroom.  <br><br>The gula melaka ice cream is wonderful &amp; smooth. Try and eat the other lighter stuff first before you chomp down on this so your taste buds dont get overwhelmed by the gula melaka.  And the banana bread cake goes very well with it! <br><br>The mango maple cake tastes very light with big mango chunks. Somehow I keep thinking of having a scoop of ice cream with the cakes here!<br><br>Will be going back to try the rest of their food. :)

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=z3rhU8TNU3fpR-Z9XlmBCA', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/xmYyQLe9PjhXGN-oByTdbg/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/xmYyQLe9PjhXGN-oByTdbg/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/xmYyQLe9PjhXGN-oByTdbg/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/xmYyQLe9PjhXGN-oByTdbg/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/xmYyQLe9PjhXGN-oByTdbg/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/xmYyQLe9PjhXGN-oByTdbg/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Lacyeloo W.', 'displayLocation': 'Sebastopol, CA', 'altText': 'Lacyeloo W.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=z3rhU8TNU3fpR-Z9XlmBCA', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 262, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 38, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I found this place first thing after arriving in Singapore. One of the top 3 reasons I come to Singapore is food. I want to eat everything, everywhere. But... even though I&#39;m just here for 4 days, I&#39;m  returning to Tianns. It&#39;s just that good. I&#39;m surprised how difficult it is to find gluten-free food in this city! Tianns does a great job of supporting us celiacs in a way that still allows us to be foodies. Good job Tianns!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/h20b3YipVl0fV7-YxcP5YQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tianns-bakery-singapore?reviewid=Q_N9NF_bQp7KPoxKJYFJ_Q&select=h20b3YipVl0fV7-YxcP5YQ', 'altText': "Photo of Tiann's Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Espresso", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Espresso'}]
text: Another TB coffee shop but there is something good about the vibe here mostly due to the very friendly staff. I stop here often for an espresso before venturing out in town. The Banana bread is good (not to &#34;banany&#34;).

We tried the waffles, bread and cottage pie all of which were superb. <br>The savory muffin was a bit of a let down - quite dry and flavor less even with the egg inside.<br><br>A couple of things they need to get right:<br>1) portion size: for the hefty amount they are charging, the food portions are very, very small. I get that they are unique and a gluten free bakery is a rarity in Singapore, but that does not give them the right to rip off folks. <br><br>2) lattes are not hot enough, even though the flavor is superb for almond milk latte.<br><br>3) seating: I wish they&#39;d have more cushiony seating. We came with different people in separate occasions and everyone complained of sore backs and bottoms after a longish brunch.<br><br>4) lack of customizations: they are totally inflexibleif you want to make minor changes and swaps to the menu. For example, we tried changing a sauce and a side on two separate occasions and once we were simply denied whole another time we were able to get it with a lot of back and forth discussion and eventually paying extra even though we didn&#39;t take the first sauce. This makes no sense and shows the staff&#39;s ineptitude in handling questions.<br><br>All in all if you&#39;re REALLY wanting some gluten free treats and don&#39;t mind spending a pretty penny for good food with frustrating service, go for it.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/S4Xq2tgCvKUcaYeD5VDOIg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tianns-bakery-singapore?reviewid=BPla7QpRsdTUuEDmpvNbWA&select=S4Xq2tgCvKUcaYeD5VDOIg', 'altText': "Photo of Tiann's Bakery - Singapore, Singapore. Long black", 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Long black'}]
text: I enjoy their coffee. Really do. I tried their long black and flat white before. I would usually go for the long black. it is properly done, without the sourness that most hip cafes seem to do to thiers. Had their gula melaka ice cream and enjoyed it. Their cakes looks decent but I have yet to try them. A rather limited selection though. The sitting area is airy and spacious, with small square tables or big long tables, nice for reading on your own, chatting with a friend, or even in a slightly larger group. My go-to place for a morning cuppa coffee after the coffeeshop nearly by for a bowl of noddles or curry rice :)

text: The concept is good but everything fell about short of expectations.  The coffee beans were good but the milk combination made a 75% kind of flat white.  All the food is served on recyclable plates / utensils which we can&#39;t imagine that&#39;s better for the environment.  The food is also just Ho-hum.   Not the best brunch / coffee place we have been at Tiong Bahru.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gmxPnIkZwGwLZgvSqOwfuw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nunsaram-singapore?reviewid=UzSVVbPJoCKC9ZFj4QrVqg&select=gmxPnIkZwGwLZgvSqOwfuw', 'altText': 'Photo of Nunsaram - Singapore, Singapore. injeolmi', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'injeolmi'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/lIHTkr5IIcnMJ9fnCGaeiw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nunsaram-singapore?reviewid=UzSVVbPJoCKC9ZFj4QrVqg&select=lIHTkr5IIcnMJ9fnCGaeiw', 'altText': 'Photo of Nunsaram - Singapore, Singapore. green tea', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'green tea'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/1abq7AMA8NO7oafqB3M-nA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nunsaram-singapore?reviewid=UzSVVbPJoCKC9ZFj4QrVqg&select=1abq7AMA8NO7oafqB3M-nA', 'altText': 'Photo of Nunsaram - Singapore, Singapore. green tea', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'green tea'}]
text: This place really doesn&#39;t need more 5-star reviews, but I *have* to rave about one of my fave desserts!! <br><br>I was late to the whole bingsoo craze (as always) and have honestly only tried 2-3 places. I was brought here by a very reliably up to date and discerning friend, and once I tried the Green Tea bingsoo (~$13), I was sold. The huge heaping bowl of icy white flakes, dusted with matcha powder and topped with a generous scoop of green tea ice cream, with free-flow condensed milk if you so wish...It&#39;s a lot for one person to eat on your own, and it&#39;s regrettably a lot more expensive than bingsoo in Korea (~$8SGD). It tastes relatively authentic though. The toppings are generous, and can be tasted throughout the whole bowl - not the type of dessert where the ending dregs are basically tasteless ice. The ice itself isn&#39;t actually sweet, and doesn&#39;t melt fast too. I love sharing a bowl with friends! <br><br>Another good thing is, the seating area (next to the glass walls of Evolve martial arts gym) is spacious, quieter than other parts of 313 or OC, and rarely crowded. Thus a great place for leisurely chats! <br><br>I&#39;ve also tried the injeolmi bingsoo, which comes with peanuts, almonds and soy flour. A little too nutty for my taste, but very tasty, and loved the little chewy mochi bits. <br><br>I can say I&#39;m confident bringing friends here to chill - can&#39;t say that about many places!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/k4ZwvHmWEuT0mfcypyWaFg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/nunsaram-singapore?reviewid=MXyX7_txvu13CYyVutCI0w&select=k4ZwvHmWEuT0mfcypyWaFg', 'altText': 'Photo of Nunsaram - Singapore, Singapore. Sesame bingsoo with almonds and red bean!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Sesame bingsoo with almonds and red bean!'}]
text: I went here 4 months ago but just writing my review now because I can still remember how delicious the bingsoo was. It was in my top places for bingsoo in Singapore, and I&#39;ve been to quite a few. <br><br>I ordered the sesame bingsoo. The ice was so fluffy and just melts in your mouth! The almonds and condensed milk went great with the rest of the shaved ice. I pretty much finished the whole thing by myself. No shame. It was that good. Or cause I&#39;m a fatty. Either one.

Nunsaram or Snowman in Korean is a fitting name for a cafe that specializes in Korean desserts and especially in variations of shaved ice or bingsu.  In addition to the more traditional ones with red beans, they have some very nice modern versions with fruit.  We tried both the strawberry and blueberry versions and they were both delish!  Both versions had a very milky shaved ice with the perfect size and texture.  The strawberry version was served with a mountain of whipped cream, while the blueberry version was served with ice cream.  They also have some other items such as rice cakes, bread, and cake, but you cannot go wrong with any of the shaved ice.  Definitely addictive and perfect for the tropical heat!

text: Big portion for affordable price. The Choco bingsoo is great. Not too sweet, just nice

Coffee is really good and affordable here! Love that the ambience is nice and quiet. I&#39;ve heard a lot about their honey bread but it&#39;s always sold out, probably try it someday! <br><br>Their red velvet cake is nice! Although albeit pricey

text: This is one of those places where you get the feeling they care a tad more about the coffee than they do about your money. I like it. <br>They have a selection of beans but I&#39;m noob. So I let them give me the default.. excellent choice on my part!<br>Their prices for coffee are standard, but they only accept cash or nets. No grabpay no paylah

text: Compound Coffee Co is a hidden gem, and hands down is my favourite coffee place in Singapore.<br><br>It is a little further out, perhaps 10 minutes walk from the MRT, but it is well worth the journey - especially if you plan to buy beans for brewing your coffee at home. The lady who runs the place is super knowledgable and was very helpful in assisting with a recommendation on which beans to select.

text: Craftsmen burger with fries ($16.90) - 3 stars<br>Nothing special. Swopped the fries out for a salad so can&#39;t comment on the fries, but they were nice enough to do that!<br><br>Tea time set ($10.90 + $1.50 for a soy chai)<br><br>Blackforest cake - 3 stars<br>More a chocolate cake with a couple of cherries and chocolate mousse than a blackforest cake. The chocolate cake itself was a bit dry but the mousse was good. The cherries didn&#39;t have much flavour.<br><br>Soy chai latte - 4.5 stars<br>This was excellent! It was the best thing I ordered.<br><br>No tax or service charge!<br><br>Ambience - 4 stars<br><br>Service - 5 stars

text: Honestly, the reason I&#39;ve been coming back here is that, 1) there&#39;s always seating, 2) great coffee, and 3) so close to home :-)  I must&#39;ve walked by this place a dozen times but never entered because I just didn&#39;t have anymore room in my belly or I was in a hurry somewhere. The ambience is pretty chill here and almost &#34;student-free&#34;. Sorry Starbucks, but I think I found a more appealing space to enjoy my coffee, tunes, and wifi.

Flat white', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Flat white'}]
text: Visited for a tea break this time and the desserts did disappoint. The flat white was average but lacked the kick it used to have. What was disappointing was the nitrogen coffee, which did not provide the smooth texture expected from the typical nitrogen infused brew but was instead filled with nitrogen foam on top. Overall, it was largely acidic and rough, lacking distinct notes. <br><br>The cakes were coated with a thick oily layer of butter cream that was somewhat hard-the same cream for both the lemon meringue and the Smores cake. This failed expectations especially since the two cakes were of diversely different flavours. I would&#39;ve expected the frosting to be infused with the different flavours and textures-the Smores one to be sticky and fluffy, and the lemon meringue to be soft and smooth, but both failed to meet expectations. <br><br>Overall, a disappointing experience given the quality brunch on the previous visit. Will not be visiting again anytime soon

Sunny lovin&#39; and coconut latte', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "Sunny lovin' and coconut latte"}]
text: Went to Craftsmen Specialty Coffee at their new Novena location for brunch on a Sunday. We ordered 2 egg dishes (Sunny Lovin&#39; and Craftsmen Breakfast) and 2 coffees (coconut latte and iced salted caramel latte). <br><br>I asked about the difference between a regular and large sized coffee so I would know if they just pour in more milk for a large or if they add an extra shot of espresso. The answer I got from the barista was confusing as he said it had 4 shots of espresso. Coffees both came out after about 10 minutes and they both tasted great!<br><br>The Sunny Lovin&#39; arrived after about 20 minutes. The Craftsmen Breakfast took 30 minutes. By the time the second plate of food arrived, the first meal was already finished being eaten.<br><br>Half an hour is too long to wait when all that needs to be cooked is bacon and eggs. Warm up some baked beans and toast, throw on some rocket and dressing and 2 pieces of smoked salmon and that was the rest of the dish.  Combined with the $20 price tag and meals coming out at staggered times; the great coffees just don&#39;t make up for the poor service and long wait times. <br><br>The washroom lights are activated by a sensor, however it did not work consistently. As I was in there the light kept turning off and not turning on. Try as I might waving and flailing my arms, I sat there in darkness and went about my business. Even after standing to wash my hands, the lights did not turn on. <br><br>After speaking to one of the staff they checked into it and the sensor is working. So maybe just bad luck for me. <br><br>If you&#39;re looking for a good cup of coffee to go then you&#39;re in the right place. If you&#39;re expecting value for their food and quick service then I would not bother going here. <br><br>Pros:<br>-great specialty coffees<br>-free water(?)<br><br>Cons:<br>-long wait time for food<br>-orders do not arrive at the same time<br>-slow service<br>-expensive for what you get (imho)<br>-washroom light sensor inconsistent<br> <br>Overall: 3/5<br><br>This was there first weekend open so I&#39;m sure they had difficulties. They had already run out of some of the items on the menu when we arrived at noon. <br><br>Really hard to think of pros other than the coffee but will return to try brunch again in a few weeks and expecting a far better experience.

Much different service by the staff here. We were greeted with an aloof cashier who didn&#39;t and couldn&#39;t be bothered to say anything beyond necessary, and her smile is golden for i didn&#39;t see it once. <br><br>Ordered sunny lovin because I had a great one at Siglap v outlet, and a croissant sandwich with German bratwurst for the Husband. Plus two lattes. One large and one regular. Except said cashier got it wrong and made both large.<br><br>The food came fairly quickly. But the sunny lovin was distinctly different in standards. Firstly it was full of poaching water, which made the muffins slightly soggy. Plus the guacamole was much less generous. It didn&#39;t spread through the entire muffin and it wasn&#39;t as thick as Siglap V&#39;s version. <br><br>Also ordered a slice of cake. Matcha green tea with salted egg yolk. Was not bad. Couldn&#39;t taste the egg distinctly but it lent a richness and rounded the flavour of the matcha. <br><br>Fortunately the coffee was just as good. Won&#39;t be back here for food.

Another day, another hipster cafe pops up on the island. <br><br>Craftsmen (of Siglap fame) have finally expanded to another location. After a while, every cafe looks almost cookie cutter in appearance. Distressed wood and unfinished metal, concrete floors and bare lightbulbs.<br><br>Apart from the lattes, cappuccinos and cold brews on the menu, some brunch items are on offer such as waffles, croissants, poached eggs, and churros. They are pretty standard and generally consistent. Maybe I&#39;ve become a little jaded given the similar options at every single cafe. I normally go for the coffee.<br><br>But I shouldn&#39;t complain too much, it&#39;s a welcome place to park yourself with a laptop instead of shuffling off to the 24 hour Starbucks across the street.

text: This coffee place is in my neighbourhood, and it&#39;s my go to place for a quiet cup of coffee that&#39;s pretty reasonably priced and decent. There&#39;s a Starbucks nearby, but somehow the ambience at Craftsmen is just way better. Plus the option of a $5 half pint of Asahi is also quite the boost!

text: New menu is bad. Nachos were constructed from cold canned white beans (weirdly sweet) and spray cheese. The chips were somehow warm, everything else was cold.

Chocolate Milkshake is heavenly.<br><br>That&#39;s the only thing I had here. The ambiance looks nice but the noise is loud. Hard to carry a decent conversation.<br><br>The crowd is mostly office types, mostly financial I guess, an occasional suit or two.

text: The place was good for conversation as it is not too crowded. The place was like 40% full and we came in around 2.30pm. Service was ok. Server came over twice to get the order. She was nice and efficient. <br>Food came quickly. <br>All the sandwiches came in sourdough bread and all were too greasy for our liking. Seems like it was buttered and thrown on to the hot plate. <br>The meat on the club sandwiches was chunky and moist. The egg was over cooked but was ok. The vege was ok. <br>Breakfast dish was normal. The sausage was good with coarse meat, not those overly processed meat. <br>Overall service was ok. <br>Mostly less stars due to greasy bread.

I come here quite a bit for client and meetings with candidates because it&#39;s near Raffles but not under ground, and close to a lot of my clients.  I like the place, but its NOISY!  I&#39;m not sure why, but I&#39;ve never been here and it NOT be noisy.  Come to think of it I&#39;m not sure why I keep coming as it makes it hard to talk business. LOL.  The lattes are good, the juices are good, and the service is decent.  It also gets hot inside.  The patio is an oven, so dont even.

text: Myself and a small group of friends came here for the Festive buffet a couple days before Christmas. First of all, I had emailed them asking for a menu (there wasn&#39;t a full listing on the website) and they responded very quickly with the information. We decided to book it and made our reservation via email as well, again receiving a very quick and courteous reply. Considering I&#39;ve had some less-than-desirable customer service experiences in Singapore, this was definitely a good start!<br><br>The meal itself was great. There was a huge variety - turkey and ham with the fixings for us Westerners, which was cooked perfectly, as well as many delicious Asian dishes. The red snapper in particular stood out to me, and I was excited to see they had Singapore chili crab and Indian mutton curry, both which were good. Not amazing, but still pleasant. There were plenty of desserts to choose from, including an amazing Christmas stollen and some good Christmas pudding with brandy sauce. The ice cream station had an array of toppings to choose from, including fruit sauces, butterscotch, vanilla sauce and more, which kept us all happy :).  There was a complimentary coffee/cappuccino machine as well.  Everything was kept well-stocked and fresh throughout the night and kept me going back for more (I pretty much had to be rolled out the door!).<br><br>The price was very reasonable, especially compared to other similar holiday buffets/set meals around Singapore.  It was $78++, and we had the &#34;cheap&#34; table wine which was only $10/glass - good price, and still tasty. We got 15% off for using our DBS cards, so the total only came to $90. For a great, varied meal with nice ambience and good service, you could hardly ask for more!  Will have to come back again outside of the holiday season sometime.

text: This is a good place for big groups. The place is spacious with different sections so it can be easy to fit many different groups and not feel hemmed in. <br><br>I have been to Cafe Mosaic twice - weekday dinner and Saturday lunch. The service was good, with constant topping up of water and removing of plates when done. <br><br>The food was average. The spread was not huge so you would not get dizzy from the many choices but it was enough for one to be filled up. There was a small Japanese section with sushi (topped with cooked food) and salmon sashimi. The cold seafood included raw oysters, cold prawns and mussels. <br><br>There was a row of cooked food featuring Asian and Western dishes and a &#34;live&#34; cooking station. There were two types of soups available and salad and desserts. <br><br>I will say the main reason to dine here is the 4 hour Saturday lunch buffet which is fantastic for catching up with friends. Not many places have a long time frame for weekend lunch buffet. <br><br>For weekday dinner, there is usually a credit card promotion offering 1 for 1 deal which makes it quite affordable.

Sumptuous slurpiness.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Sumptuous slurpiness.'}]
text: I ordinarily don&#39;t eat at any cafe in a big hotel. They are usually pretty much only so-so. One day I was turning the corner from Queen Street onto Bras Basah thinking I would look for a nice lunch spot in Chijmes. Suddenly the sky opened up and it was raining sheets when I was right in front of the entrance to The Carlton and I was starving. I walked in and over to the entrance to the restaurant, The Mosaic, and asked the hostess if I could look at the menu. The first thing I spotted on the menu was the Laksa. My brains cells just automatically said &#34;MUST HAVE&#34;. I was seated at a nice table and as I looked around I could see that this place has a huge buffet but, not for me; I had to have that Laksa, knowing that I was setting myself up for disappointment. I have had Laksa at dozens of places in Singapore and this turned out to be one of the best. A level of succulent slurpiness unsurpassed. I have been back for that Laksa several time since then. They also have very good homemade ice cream for desert. I can&#39;t speak for the rest of the menu because when I walk in I can only think ME WANT LAKSA! The staff were all very friendly, professional and accommodating. Thanks everyone; I&#39;ll be back.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/AnhIISw1_udi_LR0I9ixMQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/caf%C3%A9-mosaic-singapore?reviewid=pTjivcp1XO2hcSsgQ4sZpg&select=AnhIISw1_udi_LR0I9ixMQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Café Mosaic - Singapore, Singapore. #omnomnom', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': '#omnomnom'}]
text: Planned and booked this place for a company dinner for 18 paxx. Was looking for a dinner under $50 and the one-for-one Monday to Thursday deal meant that I would be within my budget on the $78++ original price. Started my evening with the salad tossed with crouton, cheese, bacon and Caesar salad. Next, tried the blue cheese and two other cheeses with crackers, pity there wasn&#39;t wine to go. I then piled the plate with salmon and maguro sashimi and the other seafood - scallops, oysters and prawns. A few people remarked that the oysters and sashimi weren&#39;t that fresh. I thought they were okay.<br>The chef prepared section had mushroom and vegetable kind of teppanyaki which I left out. Went for a delicious bowl of laksa with lots of fresh prawns. I then had the chef carve out a slice of juicy steak drizzled with the steak sauce and spicy mustard at the side. Four dishes down and time for the mains. The pork and beef weren&#39;t disappointingly unflavorful but the steamed fish was good and the sambas prawns awesome. I skipped on the rojak too. Last but not least the array of desserts - mango, pandan, chocolate cake, mango pudding, bread pudding with ice cream drizzled with caramel and chocolate sauce and raspberries, did not disappointed. Ended this epic meal with a bowl of gula Melaka sago which was too sweet

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3EQfOrEOCMcNn2jT8_vgcQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/caf%C3%A9-mosaic-singapore?reviewid=CBxX-Y0tb7RUfYPFxVU1jQ&select=3EQfOrEOCMcNn2jT8_vgcQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Café Mosaic - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: This is an international buffet with a wide variety of food and different cuisines. They have ala carte dishes such as Fried Black &amp; White Carrot Cake, Cafe Mosaic Burger, Fried Whole Spring Chicken, Nasi Goreng , kampong Style Satay, Seafood Mee Goreng. You can even choose to have the same dish prepared in 2 different styles.<br><br>I feel that it is suitable for gatherings and even company events as it can sit up to 290 pax and they have a special room for about 30 pax that has a projector and screen to display photos etc. Quite suitable for birthdays, luncheons, meetings and baby showers.<br><br>The service that was provided there was excellent as well. Waitresses and waiters came by frequently to check on what we needed so overall i think it is a good dining experience.

went with missus and mom in law for others day celebration. Despite many options we decided on Carlton&#39;s because it provided a box of cupcakes and was suppose to give some Molton Brown bath set. And the price was one of the cheapest in town. The place was crowded and they ran out of Molton brown so they gave us sunsilk instead. A far cry from Molton brown. Seriously felt that they must have double bookede and bust their capacity because they kept calling to check if we are cancelling our reservation. Months after dining there, we still get their staff spam calling us to interest us in their card promotions. Can be quite annoying.<br><br>Food wise it was alright. It&#39;s durian Penyet is famous and really popular. There were stations for people to make their own Rojak which was fun. The live stations were nice and the sashimis were ok - salmon and oysters. But the cooked food was not really worth mentioning but that&#39;s just coz we won&#39;t waste our stomach capacity for cheap food.

text: Great location with easy access via MRT. Stopped at esplanade station and walk up to enjoy the magnificent architecture of JW Marriott hotel. Check out the fountain with Bruce Lee&#39;s quote. <br><br>We made a reservation last Feb at BRK to celebrate an engagement this June. Communication with BRK prior to our arrival has been via email and they were responsive and helpful. <br><br>On the day of our celebration, we were seated in the area behind the noodles station next to the bar. we had the entire space there and it felt like we had the whole place. The space was beautiful. We had 9 folks around a large table and another table of 6 off to the side. The smaller table was intimate. The large table was comfortable. It was a huge table so trying to have a conversation across the table is not recommended. Plan your seating chart well. It worked out for us. <br><br>Food is delicious! There is a huge spread of food from seafood to grill to local delicacies like hainanese chicken rice. Plan your trips well. I think it is impossible to sample everything BRK has to offer but I&#39;m sure they have something for your craving when you get there. Chili crab? Black vinegar trotters? Grilled pork? Noodles? Razor clams? Fresh oysters? They have it all. <br><br>I did not eat every item available but our group of 14 came close. <br><br>Mathan and his team including Jane was very attentive. Mathan offered to bring grilled fishes to the table to save us waiting. At the end of our meal, mathan and Jane brought out a cake with a candle on it for the couple. That&#39;s so thoughtful. <br><br>I would recommend Beach Road Kitchen to anyone looking for a buffet meal anytime in a nice part of town.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zfjtfSIUd-Kyh2Za8jLnWA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/beach-road-kitchen-singapore?reviewid=3T4YQj9r8l0yOhI8cx4Jyg&select=zfjtfSIUd-Kyh2Za8jLnWA', 'altText': 'Photo of Beach Road Kitchen - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I have celiac disease and struggled to find places in Singapore that were safe to eat.  As I was staying at the JW Marriott, I was advised to go here and speak to the chef.  Chef Sid walked me through the a la Carte menu to help me find a good lunch item.  The following morning, he also walked me through the buffet to help me find options.<br><br>I had breakfast here each morning of my 6 day stay and was wonderfully surprised to see that the team had added an all new gluten free muffin bar complete with individually wrapped muffins to avoid cross contamination!  I was so impressed that Chef Sid took the initiative after learning about the challenges for Gluten sensitive/celiacs to add this offering and to reconfigure their budgets to meet our needs.  He was even thoughtful about where he placed it (near fruit, cheese and cold cut sections) so that gluten sensitive customers didn&#39;t have to walk near the bread area.  <br><br>Wow!  Thank you Chef Sid!

text: Went here for breakfast, and while a bit pricy it was great. All items were very fresh and the cold section was amazing... felt like I was walking through the fruit and vegetable section at the grocery. Fresh pastries, eggs to order and a good selection with many stations. Coffee and espresso here was great as well. With they included fresh squeezed juice for the price, saw them pouring orange juice from a jug then placing above the oranges in the fresh section.

text: Incredible Sunday birthday brunch...local, Indian, grill, seafood, the Full Monty ... but the service was stellar from servers to baloon lady to station chefs (esp Gana at seafood) to everyone who serenaded my Daughter and gave us special cake.  One of best buffets in my 33 years.<br>When the sashimi is Super fresh and tasty it tells you a lot about their standards.  Will remember this for Ma y years.

The BEST brunch I&#39;ve ever had in my life. No joke. Plenty of different stations to try but hands down my favorite was the fruits station and soup station. And can&#39;t forget about freshly squeezed juice. This place has a huge assortment of foods--I craved it so much I had to come back during my limited time here.

text: Amazing food. Great service. <br>Anyone from the pickiest eater to a foodie will find something that rocks here.

text: At $42 (Sing dollars) plus 17% per person, this place is a splurge that is well worth it as long as you come hungry. The breakfast buffet has a very wide selection of eastern and western cuisine and diverse grouping should all be satisfied. Not to miss: Kaya crepe was exquisite. Fresh young coconut juice was sweet and refreshing. Fresh fruit bar with local and international fruits. Coffee is excellent. They make a good flat white. The chicken congee was very tasty.  They make eggs, waffle and crepes to order. There&#39;s a noodle and young tau foo bar. And a salad  bar. Restaurant is nice--open and relaxing. Service is very attentive. Nasi lemak was good but the otah was mushy and not smoked enough. Curry chicken was excellent. Selection of smoked fish included smoked herring and a number of different kinds of lox. Laksa would be a good addition to the buffet.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=-MWFYgryK4-lepVw_CKEEw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Jihan S.', 'displayLocation': 'Columbia, SC', 'altText': 'Jihan S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=-MWFYgryK4-lepVw_CKEEw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 8, 'photoCount': 172, 'reviewCount': 141, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Open early around 6am-10am to JW Marriott guests for a full breakfast buffet.  The service and food was amazing. Ask for a cappuccino or a latte instead of coffee from the bar although the coffee was great also. The staff is so friendly and ensure that your meal is pleasant. They offer a variety of traditional Asian dishes, fresh fruit, waffle bar, juices, a noodle bar, and freshly made omelettes. I looked forward to this buffet since it was included in the room rental. It would be rather expensive to eat here otherwise.

J.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=FPS3zqrD5WD9S6UzN3gSZw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 11, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I almost never write poor reviews and count on one hand with fingers to spare the number of times I have sent food back and for the first time in my life have refused to include gratuity.<br><br>I came in at just after 11:00 AM on a Sunday looking for some breakfast.  The hostess really didn&#39;t want me to come in telling me I had to leave by noon because a large party was coming in.<br>&#34;Fine, I&#39;ll order quick.&#34;<br>I got seated and asked about drinks.  Flat white and a water, fine.<br>I took a look at the menu, certainly not cheap by stretch but I am on the company dime.<br>I&#39;ll get an omelet. Safe, easy, vegetarian.  The waitress didn&#39;t know what an omelet was even though I was ordering from the menu.  She had to talk to the chef twice, I just wanted  cheese and vegetables (I even said I didn&#39;t care).  The chef even came out to find out what I wanted to make sure.  Potatoes come with it.    Coffee comes.... no water.... waiting...waiting...  Out comes the chef with the omelete.... it has sauage on the side. No, that isn&#39;t going to work.  I said 3 times I was a vegetarian.<br><br>Then the omelet comes again, the eggs are scorched.  Eggs aren&#39;t supposed to be brown.  There are 5 tiny potatoes, one of which is bad (brown in the middle), no seasoning. <br><br>My water comes.<br><br>I am done here.  <br><br>They send out another waiter to try to smooth things over.  I asked, &#34;Where would you eat?&#34;  <br><br>At least I got something out of it.

Great breakfast! Like most breakfast buffets in Asia it has a wide range of &#34;stations&#34; ranging from an egg station to a salad bar. Each of the stations were wonderful...except the waffle station. The two mornings I ate there the waffle station was not manned so the only option was a cold waffle. I would imagine that it usually is manned...but since it wasn&#39;t manned when I was there I didn&#39;t get the change to experience it.

text: One of a kind! Beautifully presented and the variety is bounty less. A must for brunch while in Singapore.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=jXgxsaFVWLXJNNdkobsJHQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Ken Y.', 'displayLocation': 'Sammamish, WA', 'altText': 'Ken Y.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=jXgxsaFVWLXJNNdkobsJHQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 57, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Went here for breakfast as i was staying at the hotel next door and nothing else was open at 6 am, jetlagged.  Omg, fantastic spread for breakfast, went straight for the local foods. It was so delish i forgot about getting the usual standby, bacon eggs bagels.  Which they had as well.   The cappacino was great and included in  the price of the buffet.   Highly recommend this place. The staff were very nice to boot.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=xajmnkTCdFd2kamtaVhD6w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Olivia M.', 'displayLocation': 'Haverford, PA', 'altText': 'Olivia M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=xajmnkTCdFd2kamtaVhD6w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 34, 'photoCount': 17, 'reviewCount': 29, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Open for dinner, $78 Sing ++. Suggest skip wine pairing. Fantastic seafood room! Great sashimi, crab, smoked salmon, fresh anchovies, ceviche. Veggies good - roasted fennel, asparagus. Fresh papaya superb. Nice evening all in all.

Flat white', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Flat white'}]
text: I&#39;ve haven&#39;t been to the original One Man on Upper Thompson, but this outlet in the west is more a takeaway spot than a hangout spot.<br><br>Seating is very limited, with a roundtable in the center that seats 4 and then some counter space along the wall. <br><br>Coffee is on the pricier end starting at around $5, but it&#39;s to be expected nowadays with this hipster trend still going strong. Regardless of the $6.50 price tag, I still enjoyed my flat white.<br><br>As they have floor to ceiling windows here, they get heaps of natural light. Instagrammers, no need to bring your special lamps or tablecloths for that perfect latte art shot. ;)
- Good quality coffee - strong espresso flavor.<br>- A bit expensive for what we got but one of the best coffee shops in the area

One of the very few 24 hour diners in Singapore (and for that very fact alone we should be grateful), serving local and western delights. The food here is affordable and extremely reasonable so I&#39;m not sure why the previous reviewer put it as $$$ when this place is $. You can get a sandwich for under $5 here. A cup of coffee will set you back about $2. This is really diner food at diner prices---anyone who is familiar with American 24 hour diners will agree. Even the kitchen setup is American diner style. The food is decent for the hard-working average person, not gourmet stuff--it&#39;s hearty and affordable. I like this place for what it is, not what it&#39;s not. So if you come with right expectations, this place is great. It&#39;s not hipster nor is it trendy. It&#39;s simply a 24 hour diner serving reasonable food at reasonable prices for the reasonable, hardworking Everyman.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MfzmBFntpeqDIf5o1WEFXg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/hanis-singapore-2?reviewid=LBRUjB9HS_EDKq5rBFVOqw&select=MfzmBFntpeqDIf5o1WEFXg', 'altText': 'Photo of Hanis - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Hanis at Wilkie Edge operates 24hrs and the customers who visit the cafe are mostly students from Kaplan which is also located in the same building. You will see students taking up tables to study there for long hours and crowded during exam period. The most crowded time of the day I suppose is around dinner time where part-time students take a quick meal and rush to their lessons or orders for take away. <br><br>Hanis cafe offers a wide variety of dishes ranging from Western to Chines food, salads, main dish to desserts. You would have the same thought as me when after trying different dishes and finding none that actually stands out. Seem that they are trying too hard to offer too much thing at the same time. The reason why I still frequent the area, and why other people does, is because the cafe allow us to study there for long hours. <br><br>Besides being frequent by students, the cafe is also a place where the resident above the building have their breakfasts or place to buy breads. Wide varieties of cakes and tarts at the display shelves seem really appetizing and will be something I will want to try someday.

Many many cute containers', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Many many cute containers'}]
text: Eeeeets a tea shop that sells awesome tea leaves in trendy cute containers.<br><br>*loooooooovin&#39; iiiitttttt*<br><br>They also sell tea paraphanelia... Tea pots, tea stirrers, tea scoops...<br><br>They&#39;ve also recently stocked candies and jam to go with your tea!<br><br>How awesome is this?<br><br>And...AND they do samplings! So you can have them brew you a cuppa to try out as well as serving jam on crackers....*<br><br>White tea, black tea and green tea...fused with petals and all sorts of flavours. <br><br>Christmas tea comes heavily recommended by me!!<br><br>*footnote; sales person was very free as there was no one around we had the store to ourselves.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/sCBqzqTp8_PJwiBtNzQHqw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/lavender-food-hub-singapore?reviewid=E8MjZrRb46XhpnTF0pLZ0Q&select=sCBqzqTp8_PJwiBtNzQHqw', 'altText': 'Photo of Lavender Food Hub - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken porridge with additional century egg', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chicken porridge with additional century egg'}]
text: I tried the chicken rice stall&#39;s chicken porridge. The stall wasn&#39;t busy and the man behind was busy preparing freshly cooked rice and told me to wait for a while. <br>A few minutes later, he started preparing my porridge. First he scooped up some chicken stock into a pan and when that came to a boil, he scooped up some plain porridge and stirred that in. while the porridge was cooking in the stock, the man took some chicken breast (same chicken for chicken rice) and chopped them into thick slices. He apologized there was no fried dough sticks today. I didn&#39;t mind. And I asked to add century egg as well. <br><br>Finally he added the chicken to the pot and gave it a good stir. He poured the porridge into the bowl and then sliced up half a century egg. He asked if I wanted the condiments - fried shallots, spring onions, pepper and sesame oil. I liked that he asked and not assume I&#39;ll want everything. He was generous with the toppings. Good, because I love green onions in porridge. <br><br>The porridge was super yummy! I will be back!

This is probably as close as you can get to heaven on earth. This is a little away from the downtown area but I specifically stay in rucksack inn hostel on lavender street just to be in close proximity to this place. The food is absolutely amazing and so fresh. <br><br>The food stalls are incredibly clean. You have nothing to worry about in Singapore. The stall owners are also very friendly. <br><br>One of my favorites from this place is the carrot cake - it&#39;s made with eggs and scallops - not entirely sure where the carrot part comes from but wow, it&#39;s amazing. <br><br>Also you can eat for so little at these food courts. $2.00 will get you a very satisfying meal. Go to the tourists traps and sacrifice quality and quantity and pay $15 for the same thing. <br><br>You&#39;ve got to stop by and try the food out at this place!

text: Love all the greenery and decor - a comforting and refreshing space that pairs nicely with the food they serve here. The kid&#39;s meal was a delight to the little one and includes a baby chino and a scoop of ice cream. Will I be back? Hell yeah!

text: A stylish cafe in the Paya Lebar area that also sells various plants and other lifestyle items in addition to serving up some great food. I tried the salmon sandwich with grilled pineapple which was very tasty. Also had a freshly squeezed glass of orange juice that was good. The decor is very nice but beware this place is super popular to making a reservation is advisable.

text: I ordered their Parma Ham Benedict to try which cost me $16.90<br>My colleague ordered their vegetarian pasta. <br>My parma ham benedict is tasty. Filing too. Ambience is nice too. There is a big t.v. on the wall, a lot of flowers and furniture. Realised that they are under Xpressflower too as their staffs are wearing Xpressflower logo. Definitely will come back again for more.

I chose the Almond Croissant. It was quite good &amp; huge!', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'I chose the Almond Croissant. It was quite good & huge!'}]
text: I would love to give the place 5 Yelp stars but because the food only deserves a 3, I will settle with 4 Yelp stars after &#34;agonising&#34; about it for quite a while. <br><br>1. The garden theme <br><br>The Interior decor gets a 4.5 stars: The garden-themed cafe is beautifully decorated with lots of plants &amp; flowers, making it a little sanctuary with all the cute ornaments and knick knacks you can find all around the cafe. <br><br>It is really perfect for couples or friends to have cosy get-togethers here. Unlike other cafes, the space is big! 2 storeys all in all, and the space between each table is of a good distance! No fear of people eavesdropping on your conversation, unless of course, you speak really loudly :p<br><br>2. Florist <br><br>This place is owned by <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2FXpressflower.com&amp;s=e0b2624a6af8303359d87f8094b05e286d1b3eda7b2a73835104bf5f0b448071" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Xpressflower.com</a>, a long established florist chain with 16 outlets in SG (I found that out from their website). <br><br>There is a cold room with lotsa flowers inside. <br>It&#39;s quite fun to peek through the glass window and see what flowers they have for that day. <br><br>Very handy if you intend to just pick up some flowers to decorate your home or get a bouquet for that special someone after a meal here. <br><br>3. Furniture store <br><br>Knots is also a furniture store! Everything you see, even the chair u sit on is for sale. Who knows? I may just decide to buy one one of these days. I was really quite taken with the round wooden table and chairs we sat on during yesterday&#39;s dinner. Let me think about it lol #wink<br><br>4. Food<br><br>Unfortunately, this cafe really needs to do much better when it comes to their food. Last night was my 3rd visit and I must say I was pleasantly surprised that the dinner we had was much much better than the ones I had with my friends in the first two visits.<br><br>5. Reasonable price (value for money)<br><br>Fortunately, the prices at Knots are really reasonable. Our dinner last night set us back around $35 for our 2 mains. That&#39;s really ok by SG standards where foods in many similar cafes can be quite expensive. <br><br>So, for all the reasons above, I will keep coming back to Knots Cafe in the years to come. If only they improve on their food quality, I will happily write a new review and change my rating to 5 stars. <br><br>Review 11/50 of 2017 reviews

text: Love the food and the ambiance. From the outside, the building looks like another furniture mall. One have to look closely to see that it&#39;s a cool quaint cafe. The decor of home furnishings are all with tags which is for sale. I&#39;ve been back a few times and they have not disappoint.

text: Great ambience and not too crowded. Pretty decorations and you can buy them. You can even get fresh flowers over the counter, who weekdays free delivery! Open till late and nice cakes and pastries. Family breakfast would be the best time

My partner and I have visited  THIS location several times after work between 6-7pm.<br><br>Savory Pies are excellent.  Sticky Date cake with vanilla ice cream was great.  Earl grey cake was an excellent take home choice.<br><br>Cafe is on the small side and has a modest staff.  Considering the labor shortage at this time in Singapore they do very well with customer service.<br><br>We chose to eat inside although there is limited seating outside.<br><br>Pricing is very good.  Coffee excellent.<br><br>Although they have several locations the product did not taste like it came from a SUPER KITCHEN.  I would swear  they made it there it was so good.

Salted caramel chocolate tart with iced coffee', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Salted caramel chocolate tart with iced coffee'}]
text: Probably a good thing for my waist line that  I found this spot on my last day in Singapore.  The salted caramel chocolate tart (gluten free) paired extremely well with my iced coffee.  The flavors were well balanced, rich, but somehow not too sweet.  They also had savory buttery crusted pies and other delicious items to choose from. You can take items to go or eat in.  The space was a needed respite after a long day on my feet.  Very cozy and somewhat darkened interior, delicious food at decent prices, and friendly staff.  You order upfront and pay at the cash register. Take a number and find a seat.  The food is then delivered to you.   Exactly what the doctor ordered.

text: Great service, cute cats, and nice food. Awesome cat cafe! $S 13 for adults(per hour) , and $S 9 for kids (per hour).<br><br>Pros: <br>*Employees were very informative about the cats and knew a lot<br>*Cats were playful when we visited<br>*Cats let us pet them<br>*Cozy cafe<br><br>Cons: <br>*A bit on the pricey side (average for Singapore prices)

text: This is such a cute cafe!! It was great to come in from the heat to relax with some tea, a.c, and play with rescue cats. It&#39;s limited space so get there when you don&#39;t see it busy. The food is pricy so we just had the &#34;complimentary&#34; beverage (I understand why the prices are a bit high, though). This was our first (and so far, only) cat cafe visit in Asia. The owners of the cafe are super nice and friendly. I love that all of the cats are rescues. Don&#39;t expect the cats to be playful, they were all sleepy (which is why I prefer dogs. But hey, no judgement here)!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4pIu8JkaXIo468BRTqka3w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/meomi-cat-cafe-singapore?reviewid=tTwRsW6u9u3X9et7y2Jh0w&select=4pIu8JkaXIo468BRTqka3w', 'altText': 'Photo of Meomi Cat Cafe - Singapore, Singapore. Cats eating dinner', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Cats eating dinner'}]
text: Cute cat cafe in Singapore! The staff is extremely friendly and the decor is nice. An hour stay cones with a complimentary drink and there are also stocked and toys you can by to support the cats. My main complaint is that if you actually want to play with cats, this probably is not the place for you. You are not allowed to pick up the cats and they are also very shy, running away whenever I tried to pet them.<br><br>However, the overall vibe of the cafe is extremely nice and cute. Plus we came during dinner time and got to see the cats line up and eat!

Easily one of my favorite cat cafes worldwide - not because of the location itself, but because of the people.<br><br>Meomi is a rather tiny cat cafe in Singapore.  There&#39;s something quaint to it, really - it&#39;s one rather small room populated by a handful of cats with big personalities, making it a sort of cute refuge in a big city.<br><br>What makes Meomi so great isn&#39;t necessarily the cats, though - it&#39;s the people.  The staff at Meomi are friendly, fun, and definitely love showing off their cats.  Better yet, they make a concerted effort to make sure everyone (small children, scared patrons, etc.) experience and have fun with the cats in a meaningful way.  That&#39;s above and beyond anything I&#39;ve ever seen at a cat cafe and, frankly, really darn cool.<br><br>If you&#39;re in the area, please go here!  They definitely deserve your support.

text: This was my first cat cafe and I loved it!! We were there at dinner time so we got to see all the cats come out of hiding and eat. The cats were playful and sweet. We left before our time was up and they were kind enough to discount the price. My only suggestion would be for a wider variety of drinks.

text: I&#39;ve been to 3 cat cafes in Singapore and so far, this one&#39;s the best I experienced. <br><br>My colleague and I visited on a Sunday afternoon, and surprisingly we were able to walk in without a reservation. Unlike Neko No Niwa in Boat Quay, with a lot of rules to remember, there was only one simple rule to follow here, and that is to not pick up any of the cats.<br><br>I counted 7 cats in the room, and luckily most of them were awake and active. There were 2 of them who slept on the high ledges where no one could reach them, so we missed out on photographing and playing with them.<br><br>The cats looked happy, healthy, comfortable around people, and responded well to balls and being pet. Waving the feather toys at them didn&#39;t really seem to amuse them so much!<br><br>I loved how they had a TV that looped a clip of birds congregating and eating birdseed- how thoughtful to provide them cat TV programming! <br><br>They offer free wifi and some drinks, snacks, and cakes. I would still recommend a reservation to ensure you have a spot with these lovely kitties. Enjoy your cat therapy!

Hi Oreo!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Hi Oreo!'}]
text: It&#39;s actually my first time to a cat cafe, and it&#39;s ended up a pleasant experience for sure. Pets cafes in KL are definitely on the rise now, but I have yet to hear about a good one. The usual feedback I get after any of my friends visit a pets cafe would be that it still smell in the cafe, which is exactly something that didn&#39;t bother me at all while I&#39;m visiting Meomi cat cafe in Singapore - no smell at all!<br><br>Cats to me, I always feel like they are judging me when they are looking at me - &#39;you human, ugh&#39; I myself have a dog at home, and that&#39;s definitely different too. Staff here were very friendly when we were there, and we were lucky to have visited the cafe at a not so busy hours that we could get in straight away without any wait. Again, thanks so much to Michelle M. for bringing me to the cafe and exploring Singapore! Felt so loved!<br><br>While you&#39;re there, you&#39;d be given a few choices of &#39;ala carte&#39; or package. Basically, they charge by per hour - so if you&#39;re planning to stay more than an hour, you&#39;d have to pay for the subsequent half hour prices. But, they did mention that they will be giving a 5-minute-grace-period. <br><br>They have very few rules here in fact, and we were only told not to carry the cats or take photos with flash. Of course, petting them is still allowed. But, do pay close attention to them when they are telling you which cats they have there is friendlier, and which are less ;) I managed to see 7 of them during my visit, you gotta look all over the places to spot all of them!

text: It&#39;s clear now that I&#39;m a crazy cat lady, seeing as every city I visit, I must make my way to the cat cafe. It&#39;s becoming quite a routine!<br><br>Happy that I stumbled upon Meomi Cat Cafe while wandering around Haji Lane! It&#39;s a small space and has 7 beautiful cats for you to observe or play with.<br><br>I&#39;m not very impressed by the price of their drinks though. 13SGD to enter and see the cats and your complimentary drink is apple juice from a box bought in a store? That&#39;s a bit disappointing and expensive! <br><br>However, everything else is great! The staff members are very enthusiastic cat people and they loved to tell you more about their feline friends; how Coo has a munchkin admirer, how Lunar is a rescue cat. It&#39;s nice to see passionate caretakers! Then you know the cats are well taken care of.<br><br>I&#39;d only recommend cat cafes to animal lovers/cat people because it&#39;s just a nice place to simmer down and distress. Especially if the cats like you enough to show some love.

text: My first cat cafe experience. <br><br>Price: $13 entry fee for 1 hour with complimentary apple or orange juice. Not bad at all. <br><br>Service: The girl who worked there was really nice and shared a lot about the cats at the cafe. She introduced each cat to us and told us about their personalities. A+<br><br>Cats (the real show): We were able to interact with 4 cats today the rest of them were taking naps. The munchkin Mario was literally the cat version of a corgi. Very adorable. The curly ear cat Curlie was also insanely cuddly and cute. <br><br>Overall, I would come here everyday if I could. The cats are so chill and the people who work here really do love their jobs and the cats. I truly enjoyed the cafe a lot!

text: I&#39;m terrified of animals. But I knew my husband would LOVE going to a cat café (as he&#39;d hinted more than just once).<br><br>So for his Christmas special, I faced my fear - all 7 of them.<br><br>And their names were Junior, Coo, Curley, Frowny, Luna, Mario and Oreo - pretty cute names for the fierce monsters I imagine them to be.<br><br>I think the small space of the café was an advantage. With less room for the cats to wander, there&#39;s a higher chance you get to see, touch and play with them. The maximum capacity is about 12 to 14 people, so with 1 cat to 2 humans, there&#39;s a pretty good bet you&#39;ll be having quality time with the furballs!<br><br>And for the fearful (like me), it&#39;s easy to stay in the corner and see where all the cats are so that there won&#39;t be any surprises.<br><br>When we were there from about 4.30 to 5.30pm, a few cats were snoozing. Unfortunately, 2 of them never made it down from their resting places high above ground. Good for me, not so good for the cat fanatics!<br><br>The rest of the cats were either playing around with the cat toys held by customers, or snoozing away in view of everyone. I plucked up my courage and managed to pet two of the sleepy cats! And we even had a &#39;show&#39; of the owner cutting the nails of one of the cats, who promptly fell asleep midway.<br><br>Cats can be so lazy.<br><br>Click here for the full review:<br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwp.me%2Fp6xSip-Kt&amp;s=49f726eb773e6b7ee2d9b2f654d22a7a457a3397a182a0738048cbe10cec9072" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">wp.me/p6xSip-Kt</a>

text: This was such a fun experience. The cats are adorable and very well taken care off. The staff was so friendly and even came in and talked about the cats.

text: Level 1 right by the entrance of Raffles Hospital- you don&#39;t need to go round to Starbucks.This little place has real quality coffee &amp; other beverages plus lovely home made banana cake among other delicious breads &amp; cakes. The gentleman who runs this little gold mine welcomes everybody with his friendly charm - making everyone smile - thank you very much x

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=5xZZcgliUjuy-t32NJ0fpQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Yana M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Yana M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=5xZZcgliUjuy-t32NJ0fpQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: The uncle who works this shop is one of the sweetest people I&#39;ve met. He made my afternoon simply with a smile and was so accomadating and kind. The coffee was delicious and so was the banana bread. Would recommend it significantly over the Starbucks coffee a few steps down.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=wDCe5RM6MPb__KeOwyqbdw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/UV_US5tKtDQpqmf1pBVnYA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/UV_US5tKtDQpqmf1pBVnYA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/UV_US5tKtDQpqmf1pBVnYA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/UV_US5tKtDQpqmf1pBVnYA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/UV_US5tKtDQpqmf1pBVnYA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/UV_US5tKtDQpqmf1pBVnYA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'pennington n.', 'displayLocation': 'Union City, CA', 'altText': 'pennington n.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=wDCe5RM6MPb__KeOwyqbdw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 14, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 57, 'eliteYear': None}
text: The gentleman who runs The Coffee Stop on Level 1 of Raffles Hospital is one of the nicest people I have ever met in Singapore. He makes great espresso drinks, is kind to children who whisper their orders, has a fine selection of fresh fruits and other delectables, including doughnuts, which may be needed as a bribe prior to a child&#39;s jab. I recommend you stop by, say hi and order something. Mr. Ho&#39;s coffee will sweeten your morning and his smile will brighten your day.

Singapore style!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Seattle coffee lovers...you will be happy here. No foo foo lattes just freshly brewed Nanyang coffee. Singapore style!'}]
text: Freshly brewed Nanyang coffee and a lemon cheese bun is the best! <br><br>The smell is intoxicating and the taste will delight even the most hard core coffee critics.<br><br>I am already sad about not having a Toast Box back home in Seattle.<br><br>Try the authentic toast with peanut butter or the coconut egg tart. Both delicious! <br><br>Just like their slogan,  you will say &#34;Toast Box....I like.&#34;

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/tbW0b0QM5OjRRa18MtE85w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=ZueU8m03NnfCNy96OqYaBA&select=tbW0b0QM5OjRRa18MtE85w', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Toast jam egg and cheese. Must get!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Toast jam egg and cheese. Must get!'}]
text: Kaya Toast is life. What is Kaya? It&#39;s like a jam made out of coconut and egg, spread between to pieces of toast. Order it as a set with eggs and coffee! That way, you can dip the toast in soft boiled eggs for a classic Singapore breakfast. We prefer Ya Kun for getting Kaya Toast just because the coffee is better there. But toast box offers this other item, toast with ham, cheese, and egg, and they flame torch the cheese. It&#39;s SO good!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/UDupwT2ap6nbmTorhVyIog/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=1MEwAptUV9TGy50tyeZYWg&select=UDupwT2ap6nbmTorhVyIog', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I came here because it was ultra busy and wanted to see what the crowd is about. The place is very cute and coffee house like place that services light bites, drinks and desserts. It&#39;s great because it&#39;s one of few places that actually opens early...7:30am. I got the laska soup and a black tea. Both were fine for the price which was only 7.50 sgd. I wouldn&#39;t say it was anything special though. <br><br>Bottom line..come for the ambience or a safe place to grab a bite or drink early in the morning. <br><br>Pros<br>In a shopping mall in the basement so it&#39;s easy to get to <br>Affordable <br><br>Cons <br>Food is just ok <br>Tea is just ok

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/N_vqf3tLFwZkBMFzF_gG5w/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=zLgO8VHZKx3KP8yBe6cK2A&select=N_vqf3tLFwZkBMFzF_gG5w', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: I was referred to this place by a local and it was quick, and decent in satisfying my cravings for Laksa. Next time I might venture out of the mall but for the price I am not unhappy. <br>The coffee is strong, the Laksa filling..

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=lXQd1NDhGE1PPS2QcVR0Nw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/cdwrQ3gs4QOnwF9utwdbog/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/cdwrQ3gs4QOnwF9utwdbog/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/cdwrQ3gs4QOnwF9utwdbog/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/cdwrQ3gs4QOnwF9utwdbog/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/cdwrQ3gs4QOnwF9utwdbog/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/cdwrQ3gs4QOnwF9utwdbog/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Jack D.', 'displayLocation': 'Kansas City, MO', 'altText': 'Jack D.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=lXQd1NDhGE1PPS2QcVR0Nw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 444, 'photoCount': 1, 'reviewCount': 3, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great place for quick breakfast. Sausage roll is my favorite. Kopi Peng (local iced coffee) is my favorite.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8yRrdeoC0lEZUWVLlEYnuQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=20KCyHddaJpQEkhZXdu12A&select=8yRrdeoC0lEZUWVLlEYnuQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Chain serving kaya toast and traditional coffee / tea (Kopi / Teh) in Singapore. Both are pretty good but personally I prefer Yakun (another famous chain serving similar items). They also serve laksa, other bakery (cake, brownies, etc.) and other drinks (would recommend the barley drink). The venue in MBS is very convenient for a shopping break

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/iBcIN3fsdmj-rZEK0CjOJg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=0FRJ76ssaaCUi7V6q17M1w&select=iBcIN3fsdmj-rZEK0CjOJg', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Singaporean faves. Easy, quick, and cheap. The laksa was alarmingly delicious, and the kaya toast was simply delectable. Even the kopi is tasty!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/0MoCRq3Vm-UND0jZP-haSQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=BbfFxWAN3Js6ouWh3cn7WQ&select=0MoCRq3Vm-UND0jZP-haSQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Teh ice (milk tea)', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Teh ice (milk tea)'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jLeleXBD0FzketoO2SJ5BQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=BbfFxWAN3Js6ouWh3cn7WQ&select=jLeleXBD0FzketoO2SJ5BQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Kaya toast'}]
text: I usually go simple at Toast Box with just kaya toast (sometimes with eggs) and a milk tea or kopi. This Toast Box near Esplanade was quite good. The seating area is pretty spacious and the aunties at the counter were soooo friendly to me, which is a step up from other Toast Boxes I&#39;ve been to. As usual the kaya toast was good for a quick snack and the milk tea is always refreshing.

Toast Box is a nice stop for a break during the workday as they offer all sorts of little snacks and drinks.  The seating here is shared with other restaurants in the this &#34;food court&#34; area.<br><br>I had the plum soda which was refreshing, but very much too sweet.  All the sweet &#34;plum&#34; stuff is at the bottom, so make sure you stir it up really well.  They also have kopi/coffe, Milo, barley tea, and various other hot and cold drinks.<br><br>Not much else to be said about Toast Box - extremely affordable, air-conditioned, food court-type pick-me-up during the work day type of place.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/7MSrKyKDzw9d7cGF2Hu2yQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/toast-box-singapore-8?reviewid=aln4X0GScFZCrVyYXUKUUw&select=7MSrKyKDzw9d7cGF2Hu2yQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Toast Box - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast form toast box', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Kaya toast form toast box'}]
text: I&#39;m a fan of this place. For a food-court type of cafe in almost all the malls, this place is not pricey, it maintains a very clean and lovely image, and the food is good.<br>The citylink location can get quite busy at lunch (though, given my observations at raffle city, not as much).  I went there at around 1pm to grab some food and there was nowhere to sit. The people who work there were extremely friendly though, and tried to get me to wait for a bit for a seat, but I opted to get the takeout anyway.<br><br>Admittedly, what attracted me there in the first place was their large sign for Laksa. I realize the danger in getting laksa in a place called Toast Box, but I was not disappointed. The laksa was creamy and flavourful, and they were not stingy on the ingredients. For $4.50, that&#39;s pretty incredible. I also really wanted to try the Kaya toast there, and for $1.40 - why not? And traditional milk tea for $1? Awesome. The kaya was really really buttery though, so if i get a chance to go back, i&#39;d request for less butter. It was delicious, nevertheless.<br><br>Thumb up!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=pSPK97S_Zj2-gn5gwE1b5Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'joe m.', 'displayLocation': 'Dobbs Ferry, NY', 'altText': 'joe m.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=pSPK97S_Zj2-gn5gwE1b5Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 1, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 103, 'eliteYear': None}
text: The lava egg tart is probably the best thing i have ever had.  The crust is flakey and a little sweet and when you bite into the tart the egg yolk will run out of the center of the tart so hold it close to  your mouth so you can let it drip onto your tongue  and not onto your tie.

In desperate need for a sugar hit, a cold drink, and some air conditioning after a Sunday morning of walking around we stumbled across this Toast Box which was the only thing in the area that was open. While I was initially skeptical as I knew it was a chain store, I loved the decor and was absolutely parched.<br><br>The menu was extensive and I will forever regret not ordering the Milo toast. I&#39;d already had kaya toast that morning though, so went with the banana cake. It was a generous size serve and fresh, light and fluffy. Just what I needed. I also ordered a delicious lemon and lime drink with tapioca pearls upon recommendation from the guy behind the counter. It was absolutely perfect, and easily some of the best pearls I&#39;ve had which surprised me a lot!<br><br>My partner ordered the kaya toast set with kopi and I felt happy with my choices. He said they were okay, but the kopi wasn&#39;t as great as we&#39;ve previously had.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=bfGDb__pJ43F2GEN89ZwAg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LEQP4VGAr4xHLp0rL6u8vQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LEQP4VGAr4xHLp0rL6u8vQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LEQP4VGAr4xHLp0rL6u8vQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LEQP4VGAr4xHLp0rL6u8vQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LEQP4VGAr4xHLp0rL6u8vQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/LEQP4VGAr4xHLp0rL6u8vQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Angel A.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Angel A.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=bfGDb__pJ43F2GEN89ZwAg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 10, 'eliteYear': None}
text: When I first came to Singapore, I was instantly brought here by my friends. They kept on telling me that Toast Box is like the first place to go to upon arrival. So they brought me to the branch in Suntec City. I think it was a good idea. I liked the Milo toast personally.

I am a Coffee Bean fan.  I am....life long committed member to the Coffee Bean fan club (memberships is free and they do not issue club cards, just in case you were curious).   It is the quality of the bean that personally hooked me probably 15 years ago.  It is not as brutal a taste as Starbucks, not weak like Dunkin Donuts coffee or other similar US brands, but in line with taste as Pacific Coffee a bit.  In the end, it is all about the basic bean. <br><br>This Coffee Bean location has a large seating area and there was even a large committee meeting going on while my husband and I dropped by this past Saturday morning.  They also have food options like pasta and salad on their menu, if you needed to get in a little meal with your coffee. This was in addition to the standard bagels and breakfast type sandwiches in the cold case on display. <br><br>Seating is generous and comfortable, free WIFI and room to work, friendly staff and the consistent Coffee Bean branded quality coffee bean....I am hooked and will be back.

text: Nice gourmet coffee! I ordered the aged Samudra Mandheling coffee. The staff made the drip coffee on the table.

text: We were too full for toast, but I got an iced coffee here. Their iced coffee was legit strong, just the right amount of sweetness with the condensed milk. <br><br>The mall food court location is convenient and clean, nicely air conditioned. <br><br>Cards accepted.
