B1-80 is where you want to go.', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'B1-80 is where you want to go.'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Y2wefUBFxNEHe7EFN8Qj8A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ya-kun-kaya-toast-singapore-10?reviewid=7nexXTeic9YfaYCwWDARyg&select=Y2wefUBFxNEHe7EFN8Qj8A', 'altText': 'Photo of Ya Kun Kaya Toast - Singapore, Singapore. Menu as of April 2019', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Menu as of April 2019'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/xJCOTaX9fdB6-l7KdImw2A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ya-kun-kaya-toast-singapore-10?reviewid=7nexXTeic9YfaYCwWDARyg&select=xJCOTaX9fdB6-l7KdImw2A', 'altText': 'Photo of Ya Kun Kaya Toast - Singapore, Singapore. Set A - as you get it, nothing added', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Set A - as you get it, nothing added'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/-pKTCWo0yDwSPcr3fAlkmg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ya-kun-kaya-toast-singapore-10?reviewid=7nexXTeic9YfaYCwWDARyg&select=-pKTCWo0yDwSPcr3fAlkmg', 'altText': 'Photo of Ya Kun Kaya Toast - Singapore, Singapore. Set A - butter kaya toast, eggs, coffee', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Set A - butter kaya toast, eggs, coffee'}]
text: I&#39;ve never had Kaya toast before, so to me this is the best I&#39;ve ever had. But I don&#39;t think it&#39;s a stretch to say this may be among the best I will ever have because it&#39;s just that good. Now, keep your expectations in check. This won&#39;t be a life changing meal, it&#39;s simply delicious, inexpensive, and an experience. And you must like runny eggs and toast, otherwise go somewhere else.<br>The line will be long if you don&#39;t come early or get lucky. Plenty of set options to choose from, I got the standard Set A:<br>- the namesake kaya toast: thin perfectly toasted bread with tons of butter and kaya jam which is a sweet coconut based jam.<br>- 2 soft boiled eggs: will be some of the runniest eggs you will have, but they are delicious. I strongly recommend adding a bit of soy sauce and pepper to enhance the flavor.<br>- 1 strong coffee or tea: go with the tea. It will taste more similar to a Hong Kong style milk tea, but not that sweet. Just more sweet and stronger than the coffee you might expect. It goes well with the meal.<br><br>Eat your eggs straight from the bowl, dip the toast in the eggs, slurp down the remaining mixture of egg whites and soy sauce. It&#39;s slightly decadent but well portioned so you won&#39;t feel like a glutton. At 4.80 Singapore Dollars which as of today is about $3.50 USD, you may not find a better deal for the experience. <br><br>Pro-tip: this place is located in the basement level of Raffles City. It&#39;s a pretty large area down there so you might have to walk around. Give yourself some time to find it and then to wait in line.<br><br>Pro-tip 2: If you wan to take some home on your flight, do not get the larger jar as that won&#39;t pass security. I think the smaller multi-jar set should be OK.

PSA: Don&#39;t be fooled by the map here! The location is listed incorrectly and takes you to toast box across the street instead of into the Raffles Center! Toast Box while good and does have some toast it is NOT Yun Kaya Toast.<br><br>Eats: 5/5<br>Kaya French Toast Set with Coffee<br>Kaya Butter Toast Set with Chinese Tea<br><br>The sets come with the runnnnnny eggs add pepper and soy sauce to taste. However you might have to ask a neighbor to pass it over since they are not on every table.<br><br>French toast is good! Eggy, soft, an.... eggcellent :D way to start your day.<br><br>Kaya Butter Toast is also good but I did laugh at the huge piece of butter sandwiched between the toast. It was almost the same size as the toast but ayo I&#39;m on vacation and a little butta never hurt nobody... probably?<br><br>Chinese Tea would pass on if you&#39;re here, basically hot water with a tea bag floating in it.<br>Coffee is sweet and strong. Almost borderline too sweet but the coffee is strong enough to balance.<br><br>Personally I&#39;m not a huge fan of kaya jam it&#39;s just too sweet for my taste buds but it is a regional staple and it&#39;s yummy in moderation. The eggs here though!! Yumm! It was also nice getting to choose for each piece of toast if I wanted to dip in egg or in jam.<br><br>Service:<br>Quick but there will be a line if you go in the morning, even on weekends. Also keep in mind this is basically self-service and many of the &#34;buzzers&#34; don&#39;t seem to buzz so the ladies in the back kind of just yell the order in Mandarin if you don&#39;t come right away so just keep an eye on the counter.<br><br>Also a good thing to always keep in mind in Singapore that seat saving IS a thing. If you see an umbrella or etc on a table it&#39;s taken and since this is a small shop and the line gets long so it can be kind of annoying but I guess do as the locals do and save your spot! Especially since the line moves quickly anyways.

text: Ordered the set A, which comes with kaya french toast, egg and tea/coffee. Mix the egg with soy sauce and pepper and use the toast to dip in the egg. yummm There was so much hype and thought how good can it be right? Price was good and it was worth trying. Toast was very buttery. Reminded me of HK set breakfast but this had a twist with the egg. Both tea and coffee was good and goes well with the toast! This was also close to our hotel so it wasn&#39;t too out of the way. There&#39;s mainly locations

text: Classic Kaya joint. I ate here almost everyday for breakfast while I was in Singapore. Some of the newer creative options were nice.

text: Game changer. Life changer. I didn&#39;t know what I was missing until I tried Kaya toast. Life will never be the same. <br><br>Who knew the combo of coconut jam + crispy toast would work with perfectly cooked runny eggs. Heaven. Even bought a couple bottles of Kaya jam at the airport to take home. <br><br>A very sweet, simple, buttery, and heavy brekky. The coffee is perfect to cut the sweetness. Loved it. Highly recommend.

Oh I can eat this every day', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Oh I can eat this every day'}]
text: What is the purpose of life? We may never know.  But I know what my purpose was for booking a hotel right above this food court..  It was for Ya Kun Kaya Toast.  You may call me a dork, but I was waiting forever to try this place. The place gets packed around 10 am so get here early, there&#39;s not a lot of seating.  Just imagine, you wake up in the morning feeling like a little bit giddy,  grab your glasses and  out the door, cause you&#39;re about to hit the city ,  But before you do you remember that breakfast is the most important meal of the day.   Sure you have many other options, but what&#39;s better than toast that has a slab of butter and ka yun spread all over it? <br><br>You have several options, you can get traditional toast or french toast.  Traditional toast is by far my favorite.  It&#39;s a very simple meal, toast with a slab of butter in the middle with ya kun spread all over. I&#39;ve tried the french toast with there is egg in the center, but there wasn&#39;t enough ka yun spread.   When you eat your toast you can dip the toast in an egg that is running.   I&#39;ve added soy sauce a few times to my egg, but i think i like it more with out the soy sauce.  <br><br>There are breakfast combos and most of it comes under 5.00 and it comes with a drink of your choice of milk tea or coffee.  I actually didn&#39;t like the coffee, they might have over roasted it that day, but it was too bitter.  The milk tea on the other hand was really good. I&#39;ve honestly had this everyday when i was in Singapore, and i didn&#39;t get tired of it.  Now i&#39;m having withdrawals! Luckily i&#39;ve bought jars of the spread home, but i know once i run out, i will have panic attacks.
This has always been my go to Kaya place whenever I&#39;m in Singapore. They have the best Kaya toast! I would even usually buy their Kaya jar and bring it back to Boston.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/XoaE74oJqWSp4z6wi9KeUA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/ya-kun-kaya-toast-singapore-10?reviewid=KlU-o9Mj-_Jb0CkKr7F2hQ&select=XoaE74oJqWSp4z6wi9KeUA', 'altText': 'Photo of Ya Kun Kaya Toast - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: I tend to pass by Raffles City Shopping Centre quite a bit - so, usually when I&#39;m there, I do tend to hang out for quite a bit. Previously, I used to hang out a lot at the Starbucks over there - but Ya Kun provides cheaper options for coffee and tea. I love their Kaya Toast, and their Barley drink as well. They are also in a very good location.<br><br>What I Love: Their Kaya Toast Set is perfect.... You get coffee/tea, eggs and bread. What more could you ask for? I love local coffee and tea. Especially, when you&#39;re dipping the Kaya Toast bread in the eggs... Yummmmmmyyyy. Their prices are pretty darn good. For $4-ish, you get the whole set. It&#39;s half the price of a Starbucks coffee. You&#39;re practically having a meal here. Their French toast is yummy too.<br><br>What I Don&#39;t Love: Nothing! What&#39;s there not to like? :)

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=NUK8drx_RDOMjh4WxIBc6Q', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jXLSk8zyxUCwJdbzHzRKTQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jXLSk8zyxUCwJdbzHzRKTQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jXLSk8zyxUCwJdbzHzRKTQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jXLSk8zyxUCwJdbzHzRKTQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jXLSk8zyxUCwJdbzHzRKTQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/jXLSk8zyxUCwJdbzHzRKTQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'LT K.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'LT K.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=NUK8drx_RDOMjh4WxIBc6Q', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 2, 'photoCount': 2, 'reviewCount': 478, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Have been to the Toast Box and Killiney, and Ya Kun is by far my top choice for a kopitiam experience. It is a wonderful place for breakfast, snack, or afternoon coffee/tea. The way they make their kaya toast is better and tastier. <br><br>For a true old fashion kopitiam experience, this is the place to go.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=xF5yDvjgWCKicZPKeU6XPg', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/zFzhFP08hZGvI1JkO63QNA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/zFzhFP08hZGvI1JkO63QNA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/zFzhFP08hZGvI1JkO63QNA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/zFzhFP08hZGvI1JkO63QNA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/zFzhFP08hZGvI1JkO63QNA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/zFzhFP08hZGvI1JkO63QNA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Rick S.', 'displayLocation': 'Los Angeles, CA', 'altText': 'Rick S.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=xF5yDvjgWCKicZPKeU6XPg', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 3, 'photoCount': 123, 'reviewCount': 176, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Ya Kun Kaya is in its 69th year of serving mediocre breakfast...and they&#39;ll outlive Yelp. A toast sandwich of butter and kaya, clumped, never spread. 2 soft boiled (as the sign says: your choice, wet and runny or runny and wet). And good black tea sweet with susu.

The thing about chain food stores is they tend to lose their quality as they expand. Ya Kun Kaya Toast is one such example. The consistency of the Kaya Toast varies from outlet to outlet and depending on how busy the kitchen. The Kaya Toast I had at this particular branch hardly had butter in it and the Kaya was flaky, a truly sad representation of a local favorite. The soft boil eggs used at Ya Kun are fairly large which is plus compared to your local coffee shops that serve tiny eggs. Overall, I would avoid Ya Kun if I can find a coffee shop nearby. You practically pay half as much at a coffee shop!

I was lucky to get a table by the water as it was usually full of people. The last time I was there was over a year ago and I was pleasantly surprised to see a buzzer on the table and a notice that diners would need to be seated by the staff. I guessed they had problem controlling the crowd as the &#34;outdoor&#34; tables were around the water area, away from the main entrance. The buzzer (for service and bill) made sense as it could be a challenge trying to get the staff&#39;s attention when it got busy. <br><br>I just ordered an iced caramel macchiato as I was not very hungry. It came in a big glass and it just hit the spot. It is pretty good and dare I say it, way better than Starbucks&#39; version and I am a fan of Starbucks. <br><br>Now I know where else to go when I want a caramel macchiato. <br><br>Food wise, I am not sure if all will be good. I had the pancakes at my 1st visit and it was just average. Pretty presentation but nothing to rave about.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/urwNxAZELTnrwLu63flUCw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/the-coffee-bean-and-tea-leaf-beanstro-marina?reviewid=qqLmB0sRjAr8Rc6w3MirMQ&select=urwNxAZELTnrwLu63flUCw', 'altText': 'Photo of The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf Beanstro - Marina, Singapore, Singapore. Chocolate Souffle.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chocolate Souffle.'}]
text: The Beanstro is an enhancement of The Coffee Bean &amp; Tea Leaf®. I chanced upon it while my family and I were looking for a place to rest our feet after shopping at The Shoppes. Unlike the typical The Coffee Bean &amp; Tea Leaf® which only offers pasta, sandwiches and cakes, it offers a variety of brunch and dinner meals. Price wise, it was along the lines of TCC. <br><br>We didn&#39;t try the main courses this time. What we had was a chocolate souffle which tasted alright. I was a little bit disappointed because they didn&#39;t have ice cream to go with it.. just whip cream. But other than that, it was ok. Drinks wise, we had a hot vanilla and a cup of tea which was just an upgraded version of the usual Coffee Bean quality. Perhaps I should come back some time and try their main courses which I hope will be better than what I have tried so far.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=LIpp-CDuP59sFPiOng9O8w', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2aK28Ry7iJoaZJ-DZ7zXCA/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2aK28Ry7iJoaZJ-DZ7zXCA/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2aK28Ry7iJoaZJ-DZ7zXCA/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2aK28Ry7iJoaZJ-DZ7zXCA/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2aK28Ry7iJoaZJ-DZ7zXCA/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/2aK28Ry7iJoaZJ-DZ7zXCA/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Chern Ann N.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Chern Ann N.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=LIpp-CDuP59sFPiOng9O8w', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 69, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 1, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Had cheesy shoestring fries and two ice teas. Fries were decent. Ice teas never arrived. Left after finishing the fries and cancelled the teas. For an extension of Coffee Bean, their beverage service is ridiculously slow - we were not offered water either by the inexperienced server.

While I&#39;m more of a Starbucks person, I have to say that their hot chocolate is way better. <br><br>While it used to be the hangout for my friends and me when younger, nowadays, I don&#39;t really step into it. Until recently and not because of the coffee, but their breakfast sets. <br><br>Was introduced to it when I had an early meeting one day, and my client suggested coming here. I never knew they had breakfast sets, and price wise, it&#39;s quite similar to McDonald&#39;s to be honest. The eggs benedict i had was done perfectly and the hollandaise sauce not too sour. <br><br>Since then, whenever I have the time, I&#39;ll make it a point to have breakfast at least once a week here.

The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf Beanstro is similar to the normal Coffeebean and Tea Leaf outlets in Singapore. In Singaporean terms, we call this outlet &#39;atas&#39;, something we use to associate with the higher-end customers. <br><br>Well, you kind of expect to pay something more, since it is located at one of Singapore&#39;s proud architecture, Marina Bay Sands. Ordering a cup of coffee is enough to burn your 10 bucks. If you intend to order a main, be ready to spend some money on something I wouldn&#39;t recommend.<br><br>Service there is good, and I love how the Wi-Fi is connected so smoothly. It isn&#39;t as noisy compared to other outlets, and the air-con there is just right. Most people linger to chat there as it is considered one of the more affordable cafes in Marina Bay Sands.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=fkBVuVXOhhPx9Q3Z3NH55A', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Deborah T.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Deborah T.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=fkBVuVXOhhPx9Q3Z3NH55A', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 2, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Am at the Coffeebean &amp; Tea Leaf now and having a Medium Ribeye Steak. <br><br>Doneness is acceptable. However it is unflavourful, and it is both drenched in and sitting in some sort of a brown gravy. <br><br>Really, which reapectable restaurant will serve their steak so wet??? Besides, a good steak should be grilled as is with just a dry-rub and served with gravy. Customers who want gravy should have it served to them on the side for them to add according to preference.

With the never-ending flow of tired or hungry people in the area and an excellent location by the &#39;river&#39;, the Beanstro is inevitably always crowded. The bustling business is perhaps the cause of my unpleasant experience there. We were led to a table outside quickly and given a small buzzer when we&#39;re ready to order. However, a few seconds later, a lady, presumably one of the hostesses,  came rushing over telling us that we are not allowed to seat ourselves and would have to join the queue. We explained that we had been seated by one of the waitresses, although we weren&#39;t sure which as we hadn&#39;t taken note, and so she left to check with the other hostess. The other hostess must have insisted that she had not given us the table, so the first lady came back to ask us to queue next time, being rather insistent that we had lied. Although slightly offended, we explained patiently that we were in fact served by someone, evidence being that the menus for the four-people table had been cleared to leave just two menus for us. It was then that she realized that perhaps there had been a mix-up and proceeded to apologize. Later, we tried to use the buzzer to order our food but after pressing it numerous times and waiting for ten minutes, no one came and we gave up. We were about to ask to be reseated, hoping this might make the situation better but the queue had grown so long and we were so far behind that we realized it really wasn&#39;t worth the wait. <br><br>I have eaten here before and this one experience has probably put me off eating here again. The food is not much better than your average Coffee Bean outlet, but more expensive because of the location. There are drinks from the normal Coffee Bean menu as well as additional hot drinks but overall, I don&#39;t think it is worth the bad service.

Double chocolate muffin ($3.30) - 4.5 stars<br>Moist and they warmed it up. Delicious!! Everything I want in a chocolate muffin.<br><br>Skinny hot chocolate ($6.50) - 2.5 stars<br>It&#39;s not very rich, maybe because of the low fat milk... Made from Ghirardelli chocolate syrup so they can&#39;t remove the sugar.<br><br>Nice ambience! Good place to read or chat.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=tEza1OANJSk-3cPz5PjZlw', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Marisa H.', 'displayLocation': 'Bothell, WA', 'altText': 'Marisa H.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=tEza1OANJSk-3cPz5PjZlw', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 3, 'eliteYear': None}
text: Great-tasting coffee! While we were there, lots of folks came through to get takeaway coffee so we weren&#39;t the only ones who think so! While the coffee was excellent, the pancakes and waffles were plain and very moderately proportioned. So if you&#39;re in the mood for a hearty, American-style breakfast, look elsewhere.

text: I called strawberry cocktail - strawberry and pomegranate slush. It has a rich taste of strawberry slush. <br><br>There is a variety of bakery goods here. Seemed good but I came here too late for a sweet tooth. <br><br>This place is located at the newer addition to plaza singapura. It is outside uniqlo. So come and try out their beverages (hot to cold coffee/tea/slush) :)

text: Looking for a European/US-styled chic cafe? Look no further. You&#39;ve arrived at your destination! In my quest to search for delicious salted egg yolk dishes, I have found this wonderful gem hidden in the east.<br><br>Take the green line to Eunos, exit towards Changi road, make it across the HDB flats, and cross the streets, you have arrived at this cute little cafe! It is very small, can probably fit 10 people inside, there are also some small tables outside.  <br><br>The first thing I notice is the sign that says no salted egg yolk croissant till 1pm. I WAS DEVASTATED. yes, 1pm guys. no earlier. Luckily, there was a saving grace - salted egg yolk coffee muffin. YAY. my sister got a chicken and mushroom pie. P.S. at this point we realize all that is served is found in the cooler by the cashier. There is no kitchen, so they can only reheat the pastries and cakes already in the cooler. My muffin was reheated within 5 minutes, while the pie took more like 10-15 minutes. <br><br>In the meantime, my sister enjoyed a hot chocolate, while I enjoyed my cold brew coffee (dark roast). My sister enjoyed her drink, while mine is definitely a smooth and dark roast. It was a little too acidic for my sensitive stomach, so I&#39;ll want to try the light version next time.<br><br>The salted egg yolk muffin was delicious. the best I&#39;ve had outside of liu sha bao.  I love it so much I got another one to go. The coffee taste in the muffin balanced out the sweet and salty egg yolk flavor. The sauce was a little crusty and it was definitely very flowy. so goodddddddd. P.S. it was still good after i reheated it after a few days. <br><br>And when I got the to go, Roy, the friendly owner, told me that he had leftovers of salted egg yolk croissant!!! Obviously I had another to go. Roy had such nice packaging boxes and bags for me to bring my delicacies away. And yes, the salted egg yolk croissant was crispy and filled with runny egg yolk sauce. It was the best I&#39;ve had and I can&#39;t wait to be back to get more soon...!!!

Tuna Mayonnaise $7.80', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Tuna Mayonnaise $7.80'}]
text: Black &amp; Ink is nestled just a stone&#39;s throw away from Eunos MRT. You can&#39;t miss the huge store sign going along Changi Road. There is also a bus stop right in front of the shop, so even for someone who lives up North, it was still convenient to pop up.Straight away you will realize that though the cafe is horizontal wide, the dining area looks small in the right corner. However, once you step in, with the comfort of the air conditioning, along with the white and black tones, you somehow feel like you&#39;ve stepped into a traditional &#34;kopitiam&#34;!<br><br>I liked how you could feel all cosy and in this 16 seat dining area. We did end up spending about 2 hours here and not once did I think that the dining area was too small. The second you step into Blakc &amp; Ink you are greeted by their cake offerings, which are pretty overwhelming!When I first spoke to Roy the brainchild of Black &amp; Ink and asked for an online version of the menu, he explained that he created the menu around the coffee and hence, they have &#34;damn good&#34; cakes, pastries, gelato and breads.<br><br>Their breads are made from natural yeast and everything else have no preservatives and additives. There&#39;s also less sugar in the cakes and gelato too.I was attracted to this place because of the pictures I had seen about their cookie cups. I mean, waffles served with ice cream is so over done now. It&#39;s time we moved on!They had a wide range of gelatos to pick from, all of which came down to Roy who personally promoted each flavour to us, based on what we liked. Thank you Roy for trying to meet our every need!The cookie cups looked alot bigger than I had expected and at $2 a cookie cup, I needed at least 2 of them!<br><br>1. Salted Egg Yolk Muffin $4.80<br>Coffee is best paired with cakes and muffins and in this case, Salted egg yolk muffin!The colour of this warmed up muffin was so appetizing!!<br><br>Roy explained to us how best to eat it! The salted egg yolk colour with the brown muffin was just terrific! The browned exterior of the muffin was slightly crusty and almost like eating a cookie.The muffin itself was quite dense as such, it held up well with the salted egg sauce and didn&#39;t turn the muffin soggy. I tasted a slight coconut flavour from the salted egg and I liked the sweet lemak aftertaste! <br><br>2. Bread of the day with tuna mayonnaise $7.80 <br>So here are the options for mains at Black &amp; Ink, they don&#39;t exactly have a fully equipped kitchen for cooking, but they have ovens and simple cooking techniques could still be applied.Here is the focaccia with tuna mayonnaise. Roy said the bread was made with all natural ingredients, natural yeast, herbs, extra virgin olive oil, etc., which probably explains why the bread was so yummy! Definitely for the health conscious! <br><br>3. Spicy Lemongrass Chicken Burger with Mayonnaise $8.80<br>After the delicious focaccia, we tried the burger. The buns are made with natural yeast and scattered with mixed seeds. It shows how much Big Roy cares about your health! The chicken itself wasn&#39;t spicy even though it&#39;s titled &#34;spicy&#34;, it&#39;s more of a &#34;green curry&#34;, thai style chicken. <br><br>4. Hot Coffee<br>Manager Big Roy is trained in The Coffee School of Australia and is a certified SCAE advanced level Barista, so you can always expect an excellent cup of coffee here at Black &amp; Ink! This cup truly aroused my senses, so much so that I went home and headed straight to the gym! I definitely wish I had this cup of coffee everyday before work!<br>They also sell beans to take home with you so you can enjoy this goodness anyday!<br>Coffee beans are the center of everything in this cafe!<br><br>5. Tapping Tapir Pineapple Calamansi $4.50<br>Upon Roy&#39;s recommendation, my friend decided to get one of these fruity bottled drinks, that was supposedly a soda, but had very little carbonation, which we appreciate!<br>Tapping Tapir Pineapple Calamansi - Very Refreshing!!The drink was very refreshing and the taste of the pineapple and calamansi was a great compliment, they paired up well!<br><br>6. Mao Shan wang in cookie cup $7<br>Okay, so I love durian but I&#39;ve never actually found a durian ice cream that I liked. Some were too sweet, too artificially coloured yellow etc. But Roy did it right! I was luckily enough to come on a day whereby he was churning his first tub of Mao Shan Wang sorbet and unlike other fruity sorbet, this durian itself is creamy, hence even though it&#39;s termed a sorbet. It was creamy goodness! You could close your eyes and imagine that you were eating the real durian fruit! The cookie cup added a perfect crunch to the durian gelato as well!<br><br>7. Very Dark Chocolate Sorbet and Good&#39;ol Days in cooke cup $9<br>All ice creams should be served in cookie cups!The dark chocolate sorbet was yummy, but I was still bigger fan of their award winning Good&#39;ol days, as Roy termed it &#34;Chendol without the chendol&#34; and it really was! I loved the salty and sweet gula melaka taste and it paired up well with the dark sorbet.

White coffee', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'White coffee'}]
text: (1) Masala Chicken set at $8.50 (croissant at +$1) (cheese at +$1)<br>- Boss Roy kept telling me how good this new sandwich was, strongly recommend me to try it and so I DID! First bite and I was already impressed. The croissant was very crispy, flaky and best of all it&#39;s super buttery! The usual combi was onion thyme with chicken masala but I upgraded it to croissant, definitely the right choice. Chicken thigh slices were tender, the masala meat sauce was really savoury. I request for cheese to be added and love the warm melting cheese moments! If you&#39;re not fond of chicken, Black &amp; Ink also serves egg mayo sandwiches.<br><br>Other than cakes, lava muffins, danish and the sandwiches, Black and Ink now also invades the world of pies. Introducing us with flavours including lamb shank, beef rendang, wild mushrooms, bbq chicken and beef goulash. I gave the bbq chicken and beef rendang a try.<br><br>(2) Bbq Chicken Pie $6.50<br>- This lovely, light buttery crust pie comes in a rectangular shape. Every time I fork in, there&#39;s generous chunks of tender chicken cubes. Bbq sauce was sweet sourish with mild spicy peppery aftertaste. A decent choice.<br><br>(3) Beef Rendang $6.50<br>- Beef rendang, usually ate them at a Malay nasi padang stall, first time in a pie (IKR, I&#39;m a mountain tortoise). The coconut milk aroma was fragrant. Juicy tender beef cubes were also cooked together with carrots, potatoes and chilli spices. Flavour was good but can be heavier. Spiciness level can increase too. <br><br>Both pies were quite filling, suitable as a lunch meal for ladies.<br><br>(4) Dark Chocolate Lava Cake set $8.50<br>- First look at it didn&#39;t impress me because the plating was bad. But people always said &#34;Don&#39;t judge a dessert by its appearance&#34;.. And true enough, the taste says it all. Thick, luscious dark chocolate slowly flows out of my lava when cut. So thick, It&#39;s a &#34;throat choking&#34; indulgence that chocolate lovers must definitely give it a shot. I paired mine with another scoop of banana peanut butter gelato (Top up $ because it comes with vanilla) and it&#39;s HEAVEN! It will never go wrong when chocolate, peanut butter and banana comes together. There were many other gelato choices available but do note that there will be additional charges.<br><br>(5) Pear Danish<br>- Small and petite, it would be a great choice for afternoon snacks with coffee or tea. Having slight crisp on the outside, danish fluffy and airy inside. Not only adults love it, the sweet candied pear fruit in the center would attract kids to love it too. If you&#39;re lucky, you could get their signature apple crumble danish too (runs out fast).

text: Small cafe on the east side that is a nice getaway if you don&#39;t want to be surrounded by a full house. Great pastries (croissants, cakes, sandwiches) on top of drinks. Owner is very friendly too! Prices are a bit steep for drinks

text: Pretty small yet cosy cafe which is located in walkable proximity around Eunos MRT station.<br><br>Came here on a Thursday night and wasn&#39;t that crowded. Since we had $40 to spend on, we decided to try out the salted egg muffin, bread of the day with tuna mayonnaise, spicy lemongrass chicken, tapping tapir pineapple and calamansi (beverage), mao shan wang gelato in a cookie cup and very dark chocolate sorbet as well as good ol&#39; days in cookie cup. <br><br>The food was prepared rather quickly since the cafe wasn&#39;t too crowded. While waiting, we enjoyed sharing our travel journeys with the owner himself. I was also starring at the nicely decorated interior design most of the time. <br><br>Food wise, the mains are alright to my tastebuds. But.. the salted egg muffins and the different gelato especially the durian flavored one on the cookie cups was one of the best I have tasted thus far. The salted egg muffin was soft and moist on the outside and the runny &#34;yolk&#34; made the flavors to burst while consuming it. Those two are the most recommended items here as for me. <br><br>I also managed to choose the right beverage. Fruity and refreshing are the two words I will use to describe the taste. Definitely a good mix between pineapple and calamansi.<br><br>Overall, I enjoyed my conversation with the friendly owner and the two recommended items mentioned earlier. Will definitely be back for those two special dishes :) Cheers!!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/WdeLLMOqGPjojYgZX3IgzA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/black-and-ink-no-title?reviewid=14T1vTkeaB1fFcklaXeiDQ&select=WdeLLMOqGPjojYgZX3IgzA', 'altText': 'Photo of BLACK&INK - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: A small cafe that seems to make some people from the offices in the building happy -  mostly get their fix as take-away. Though small, looks like it can comfortably sit around 15 - 20 people. Nearest MRT station is Eunos, and it is easily accessible as it is situated along an arterial road. <br><br>It has a monochrome interiors with black and white tiled wall and furniture. A look different from the modern industrial look that most newly opened cafes take on. This one feels like a traditional coffee shop given a modern twist. <br> <br>Opened early this year, it serves mainly coffee, tea and cakes, as it lacks a proper kitchen. I enjoyed my flatwhite that late morning, it was not too heavy with a caramel undertone. They serve their house blend. I chose their carrot cake (with pineapple and cranberries) that was moist and not to sweet.  <br><br>The lady serving us at the counter was friendly, and so was the owner. He did not mind having a small chat, and mentioned that they are working with a social enterprise to bring in sandwiches soon. Hope it works out for them, as I will return for their coffee and it will be good to be able to get a small bite at the same time if I need to.

text: Good coffee. Tried their house blend and another black and both were good. Had a salted egg pastry that was really yummy. Will try to get the rendang pastry next!

We were walking down Tanjong Pagar Rd one night in search of some dessert and this cute, nostalgic looking dessert cafe caught our eye. It was quite bustling on a late Saturday evening. We were particularly drawn in by the old school props -- the interior design was quite thoughtful and unique. Even after stopping by, we weren&#39;t entirely convinced and proceeded to continue walking down the street to explore the other options. After walking to the end of the street with a Bingsoo dessert shop, we concluded 5 The Moments had the best ambiance and walked 10 minutes back. That&#39;s how much we liked it.  <br><br>The matcha green tea ice cream was one of the better ones I&#39;ve tasted, with real matcha powder flavor. Molten lava cake is already one of my weaknesses..not to mention another one of my weaknesses... green tea along with it! The green take molten lava cake also had a slight bitterness at the end, a clear demarcation of actual matcha powder flavor.<br><br>If green tea isn&#39;t your thing, there&#39;s also a wide selection of ice cream and waffles. There&#39;s wifi too, which is yet another reason to linger here a bit longer, soaking in the ambiance. Great place to chill on warm evening or as a respite from a long hot day.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/mNakML3tuDAfFbbdALxoLw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/5-the-moments-cafe-singapore?reviewid=6IlUVYz3TARb5IL1RLZyhw&select=mNakML3tuDAfFbbdALxoLw', 'altText': 'Photo of 5 The Moments Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/v62xVLrTRHFzNYz6cyskOw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/5-the-moments-cafe-singapore?reviewid=6IlUVYz3TARb5IL1RLZyhw&select=v62xVLrTRHFzNYz6cyskOw', 'altText': 'Photo of 5 The Moments Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kjdNXSE6vcp3B1EFLuSsvg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/5-the-moments-cafe-singapore?reviewid=6IlUVYz3TARb5IL1RLZyhw&select=kjdNXSE6vcp3B1EFLuSsvg', 'altText': 'Photo of 5 The Moments Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/CRI7GqMNywoWYt-YOZjPFA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/5-the-moments-cafe-singapore?reviewid=6IlUVYz3TARb5IL1RLZyhw&select=CRI7GqMNywoWYt-YOZjPFA', 'altText': 'Photo of 5 The Moments Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: A cute, hipster cafe in the OG hipster neighborhood of Tanjong Pagar. They have a nice collection of ice cream flavors, as well as coffee, craft beer and snacks. We had the rum and raisin and blueberry cheesecake flavors which were really good. They also do ice cream on waffles which seems like a very popular dish, will try it next time we come here (and manage to get a seat, super busy place).

Not bad ice cream, but quite pricey for the mediocre quality that you get.<br><br>While the menu lists that a small cup costs $4.80, I was surprised to find that they charged an extra $1 on top of that for a &#34;premium&#34; flavor. I ordered the pistachio flavor and sat in the back with a group of friends after a delicious meal next door eating Korean BBQ.<br><br>The bright side is that they have plenty of seating and rarely enough of a crowd. If you ever need a quick dessert stop after dinner in Tanjong Pagar, 5 The Moments might do the trick. I would never come back here to seek out the ice cream by itself though.

Pretty brownie with matcha ice-cream. Yummy!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Pretty brownie with matcha ice-cream. Yummy!'}]
text: No a bad place for ice-cream. It&#39;s an ice-cream parlour cum bridal shop...so.... A little schizo but hey, I&#39;m all for marrying businesses together. <br><br>Their brownie with ice-cream wasn&#39;t too bad. Very nicely plated and only $6.90. For tanjong pagar area, that&#39;s decent!! It&#39;s a quiet cafe so it&#39;s perfect if you don&#39;t want to be disturbed.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/msADwp5IYkAoPxdHZHlVMA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/5-the-moments-cafe-singapore?reviewid=R7-4CtHUUrc9apQqvyR1sA&select=msADwp5IYkAoPxdHZHlVMA', 'altText': 'Photo of 5 The Moments Cafe - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: So Cute, I can&#39;t stand it! I was walking around my new hood last night and stumbled upon 5 moments.  I could go for some ice cream so why not?  I tasted the durian, nutella, vanilla bean and strawberry (yep, I&#39;m one of THOSE people) and ended up with the milk tea, which was dee-lightful! The service was super friendly and I loved the kitch aspect of it.  I also had a green matcha lattee which I really liked, not too sweet.  Prices I thought were really reasonable for the area, and the quality was good.  Great place for a coffee study sesh, or after dinner date.

Chocolate ice cream with peanuts!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Chocolate ice cream with peanuts!'}]
text: This place is perfect. They have the best ice cream, a super cool vibe, and the staff is super friendly. When it gets to the wee hours of the night they tend to run out of waffles but still, this place is great for a late night fix of your favorite ice cream. I even mustered up the courage to try the durian flavored ice cream. Let&#39;s just say I&#39;ll stick the cheese cake and chocolate ice cream for now!

text: Great little cafe with awesome ice cream and lots of coffee choices. Plus very carefully selected decorations from the last 50 years. We really enjoyed it here :)

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=lcdV4nTZEEWxT5-CLb7OQQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/assets/srv0/yelp_styleguide/514f6997a318/assets/img/default_avatars/user_60_square.png', 'srcSet': None, 'markupDisplayName': 'Sajid B.', 'displayLocation': 'Sunnyvale, CA', 'altText': 'Sajid B.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=lcdV4nTZEEWxT5-CLb7OQQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 46, 'eliteYear': None}
text: This is a hidden gem in the Thomson and Upper Thomson area, tucked away near the Clover Park and Thomson Rise neighborhoods. Bright and happy casual ambience. Just had a perfect breakfast of toast and eggs washed down with a delicious cup of coffee. All served tastefully and lovingly with real cutlery and crockery ! Scrambled eggs were warm and moist and savored with toast and generous just right amount of butter. Friendly people and smiles all round. Great music playing softly in the background so conversations are actually possible with a good friend. Kudos to Anne and the staff here for creating such a pleasant space. Limited menu but executed to perfection.

Chicken and mash', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': 'Chicken and mash'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/9nYouiGZQqgJ2dCoo1yvIQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/tsp-coffee-singapore-2?reviewid=K6YUbND9z4822uwoR31hxw&select=9nYouiGZQqgJ2dCoo1yvIQ', 'altText': 'Photo of TSP Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: Great ambience and place to chill right in the midst of Pemimpin housing estate. I wouldn&#39;t have known of this if not for a friend who lives close by. <br>Post COVID-19, I met my university mates to catch up during one of our birthdays. Foodwise, they had all day breakfasts, lunch and dinner menus. The staff were nice and friendly. <br>I ordered the chicken and mash as recommended by the staff as one of their popular mains, which I found to be a tad too salty but the mash potato was nice and creamy, balancing the saltiness of the chicken chop. Lunch set comes with iced tea for $1 so that&#39;s a good deal. The bread pudding was pretty good too.

text: Cozy little cafe. <br>Clean and open space with high ceilings. Small and big tables for couples or groups. <br><br>Quality Food.<br>Very happy with my waffle and sandwich. It was delicious and visually appealing. <br>They have vegetarian options and a variety of categories of food. Sad they removed french toast from the menu. <br><br>Okay Service.<br>Minus a star. Could not be 5 star review because the staff did not greet me as I entered. I dont think they even noticed me enter the premise and walk over to the table my friend sat at. They also did not give us acknowlegment  that we had to order at the front counter and not at our table so we found out after waiting awhile and seeing others who were seated long after us were getting their menus collected. <br>They were nice to ask us when we wanted which plates out first and thanked us later as we left.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FhOHMvpnoLCHP3b9usCshQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=DdrIUAij95uDXoVn5qGy9w&select=FhOHMvpnoLCHP3b9usCshQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Waffle with ham and egg', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Waffle with ham and egg'}]
text: This place was okay. I had the waffle with ham and egg. It was tasty, but nothing i couldn&#39;t make myself or would come back for. <br><br>It&#39;s a cute spot with some nice decor, located upstairs the building. I think it would be nice just for a coffee break, but I think the food was wayyyy overpriced for what you are getting.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/80HIGLQ8xJ6UdfhpiB6NzA/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=1xydAlqMLwQ_pkPCW16UAw&select=80HIGLQ8xJ6UdfhpiB6NzA', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4JjAx53d6BBfuVMJompMYg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=1xydAlqMLwQ_pkPCW16UAw&select=4JjAx53d6BBfuVMJompMYg', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/S5K4fSuS7NKlzc-AbD5zTg/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=1xydAlqMLwQ_pkPCW16UAw&select=S5K4fSuS7NKlzc-AbD5zTg', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/uy8aLa9ucczo6zJaAfT7ww/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=1xydAlqMLwQ_pkPCW16UAw&select=uy8aLa9ucczo6zJaAfT7ww', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': None}]
text: Chili crab pie ($17) - 2.5 stars<br>The chili crab filling was a bit too sweet, dry, and maybe wasn&#39;t exactly flavourless, but it didn&#39;t have that umami kick to satisfy. The pastry was dry as well. Wouldn&#39;t order it again.<br><br>Waffle with matcha and earl grey ice cream ($14) - 4 stars<br>The waffle and ice creams were excellent! I&#39;d come back for this.<br><br>The cleanliness of the place was a little suspect - the cutlery had odd stains on them. Overall my friend was rather put off on the whole. I&#39;ve been here 2 or 3 times now and would probably try other cafes in the area before returning.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hnSRwKuYDmJQDwouXU2tuQ/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=dUzWwyzff1lBg7KP8c8tcg&select=hnSRwKuYDmJQDwouXU2tuQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': None}]
text: Group Therapy offers a casual environment for people to enjoy brunch and/or coffee in a loose setting where you don&#39;t feel rushed out the door. <br><br>I came by here on a Saturday afternoon and was surprised by the number of tables and seats available. There is a mixture of tables (standard and high) as well as couches that are available at various &#34;rooms&#34;, giving visitors a number of choices based on your preference. <br><br>I tried the Almond Latte which I found to be tasty, at $6.50. There was no queue and the coffee was delivered to my table a few minutes after I sat down after ordering at the counter. <br><br>I brought a book to read at the cafe but found the ambiance a bit too noisy/social for me to have a peaceful read. Overall decent offerings in the Tanjong Pagar  area. Will have to come back to try the brunch food next time!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/E_FYQGc1WxZfCXLqWoqQAA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=Tn6-HMy6i22o6TnQyWWlGA&select=E_FYQGc1WxZfCXLqWoqQAA', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. French toast!  amazing!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'French toast!  amazing!'}]
text: I will start by saying this place is a little hidden. you need to take a set of stairs to get to the seating area, and since I wasn&#39;t expecting this, it did take me a bit to find it (maybe an extra 5 mins)  but, it was worth it. <br><br>inside decor is cute, and there is a sofa area to sit or longer family size tables. mainly for 4 groups of 4-5. not a huge seating area so I can see this place getting busy. they have a diverse menu, serve breakfast all day, but have soups, waffles, pasta....i opted for their French toast. it was so good. I would go back ag as in just for that.  their Oj was fresh too. my friend had the beef stew and it came with a nice slice of toasted garlic bread. <br><br>a nice place to catch with friends over good food!

The name of this joint just makes me laugh, perfect. <br>I&#39;ve passed by here 12987 times since it&#39;s across the street from Lululemon and right by Cru and Yoga Lab.  You have to look for the sign and walk up stairs.  Very sneaky.  Anyway, had some friends in town and we went for brunch.  Cute little place, but make sure you order at the counter, we waited at our table for about 10 minutes before realizing this. Had the eggs benedict, the pancake stack and the creme brulee waffle.  All delish, but the pancakes were the REALLY good.  Coconut lattee rounded things out.  Nice service, but it does get crowded later.  Def. will be back!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/uMvEccGqB6H6O1e1Z6z-og/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=nfRjxWSFn8H0nEdZl1S9Gg&select=uMvEccGqB6H6O1e1Z6z-og', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: If you don&#39;t know it exists, it&#39;s easy to walk by Group Therapy. But make sure you don&#39;t, because this hidden gem really is just that -- a gem. <br><br>The owners of this place are incredibly warm and friendly and that is reflected in the service. Everyone who works there is great. I love that you can come to this place with a laptop and sit for hours. And it helps that the coffee and food is delicious. At one point, my husband was completely addicted to their almond lattes. Personally, it&#39;s too sweet for  me, but I do love their regular coffee drinks. <br><br>Their food is also very good. They use good ingredients and serve them with a smile. All in all, the experience here is fantastic. <br><br>They&#39;re also an event venue!
Good coffee. Nice relaxed ambience and food was decently portioned. Lots of such cafes but this holds its own and I will come back again

Fantastic coffee and decent breakfast noms, but it&#39;s pricey and the service can be a bit plodding. I love the atmosphere of the place and its story, but I&#39;m not sure it&#39;s worth nearly SGD 50 for two people to have brunch.<br><br>A+ for flat whites, though!

Came here with high expectations because of the yelp reviews and pictures. But left with disappointment.<br>Ordered a cup of herbal tea since it was late and didn&#39;t want to take any more caffeine. But the tea bag was just soak into a cup of warm water, first time drink tea in a warm way. Felt like paying S$5(or S$6)to get a cup of warm tap water. <br>I was excited about the sunny side up toast since I love thick toast. But the toast was hardly toasted, warm outside and cold inside. <br>Won&#39;t come back anymore. Just give one more star for the chilled environment and free wifi (ask for the password)

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/imGJitczoiU8qJ6-RTb7vg/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=tFlWjCEBIy72pgvi3WWmzA&select=imGJitczoiU8qJ6-RTb7vg', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Check this out! So yummy, right?!', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Check this out! So yummy, right?!'}]
text: Not everything at Group Therapy is good but most of their dishes are yummy. Like their chili crab pie. And their brunch items like poached eggs and their croque Madame. Their waffles are not too bad too! A tip: they don&#39;t take reservations. Only walk-ins.

text: Located at the second storey of a quaint shophouse, this is certainly an excellent place for a weekday lunch getaway.<br>Good variety of mains as well as all day breakfast with good coffee. Definitely recommended. Try the Shepards pie as well as the poached eggs

Wild Mushroom Truffle Ravioli', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Wild Mushroom Truffle Ravioli'}]
text: It&#39;s embarrassing when I rave about a place to my kakis and when I finally force everyone at gunpoint to grab a meal here, the food sucks.<br><br>That&#39;s what happened a couple of weeks ago. My kakis at that time were a bunch of my colleagues including my boss.<br><br>Up until then, I&#39;d always been a fan of the WIld Mushroom Truffle Ravioli. The menu changes every week, last I checked, it wasn&#39;t on the menu.<br><br>The raviolis must be hand-made (thumbs up). But this time, they were barely stuffed with anything. One of them had nothing inside (thumbs down).<br><br>So, I won&#39;t be coming back here. I don&#39;t like guessing what kind of quality I&#39;ll get.

text: Waffles are awesome. But chocolate sauce is very amateur effort. Diluted Hershey style. <br>Corn fritters are not to be missed. <br>Pancakes are really good too. Love their salted caramel sauce.

text: People have different taste of coffee, so I wouldn&#39;t make a comment about it or the review reflects it. (But, just to let you all know, the coffee tastes too acid, which I don&#39;t usually like)<br><br>Overall, the coffee was not hot but warm.<br>My wife got a tea and the water wasn&#39;t hot but warm, so the tea had no taste whatsoever.<br><br>I wouldn&#39;t come back here for sure.

text: It is best if you visit on a friday or saturday where they open till late! <br><br>It gets busy during mid noon time. If you&#39;re near outram park mrt or chinatown mrt, you can make your way to this cafe to chill or just to hang out with friends. <br>This cafe&#39;s specialty is their all day breakfasts! I tried their poached egg with salmon and it is just heavenly~!<br>Their salmon is fresh and off a good proportion. (Now just a thin slice of salmon) The poached egg is good as well. Not over cooked and under cooked. The sauce they used is hollandaise sauce and it compliments the whole dish very well. :)<br><br>I will definitely go there again!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/NuMBKmxUwkTcTBPGyxmFJA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=YA0D48klYrgwi7nNdsD8Fw&select=NuMBKmxUwkTcTBPGyxmFJA', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}]
text: Housed in a shop house along the iconic Duxton belt, group therapy whips up a mean all-day breakfast menu. <br><br>I had their Poached Eggs &amp; Smoked Salmon ($15) on Thick Toast and roasted almond latte. The hollandaise sauce coupled with salmon on top of a thick, well-toasted toast was delightful breakfast food. <br><br>Their roasted almond latte ($6.80) tasted of distinctively of almonds (duh). It was special because of the flavour, but not spectacular. The café also comes with a selection of interesting beers and ciders. <br><br>A creative vibe can be felt, as many artistic-looking types congregate to discuss work or just peace out. The venue is open for booking, I rememebr attending an event Group Therapy hosted for TED (<a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.TED.com&amp;s=94e6c315a9fd9bdc0f37fc4f5d2685e84de8a7e72e257ea5509960e1b6c78615" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">TED.com</a>), which I really enjoyed. <br><br>The staff are friendly, patient and approachable, plus there are quite a number of powerplugs nearby - which makes it a prime place to get stuff done.

text: Runny poached egg - check.<br>homemade hollandaise sauce - check.<br>thick brioche toast - check.<br>Great coffee - check.<br><br>happy camper - check.<br><br>I&#39;ll be back.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/RJktnIq7EjkRV7NIfqXlGA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=3jDNIFTysFtqk0nErTm8tg&select=RJktnIq7EjkRV7NIfqXlGA', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. pecan pie', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'pecan pie'}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/3W-H_fSecV45aWMwdaA1pw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=3jDNIFTysFtqk0nErTm8tg&select=3W-H_fSecV45aWMwdaA1pw', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. a hipster shot', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'a hipster shot'}]
text: we stopped here after a utterly brill dinner at etna (just downstairs from this place), just to grab a bit more dessert and coffee - really, just to give in to the greed.<br><br>it had high standards to live up to, as the cap to a great meal - but fell a tad short. our pecan tart - always a delight to order and anticipate in light of the gluttony that ought arrive - was definitely packed tight with nuts, but those lovely things were bound with a strange sort of caramel. not sticky, or fragrant with the flavours of burnt sugar, this seemed rather like a slightly gummy type of uhm, gum. not quite worth the calories, and I gave up just a bite in.<br><br>the drinks were pedestrian, but it was enough that night for us to sit down and chat. we&#39;d had a good time with the italian meal downstairs - and this felt rather like a rather calming bit of something to tide us over till bedtime. objectively speaking, it wasn&#39;t sparkling, and the queues are outrageous for something so.. normal. but it&#39;s a bit of hideaway (though a crowded one), prices aren&#39;t mad and the stuff isn&#39;t terrible - so it might just work if you were in the area.

Latte, butter and cyrup waffles', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Latte, butter and cyrup waffles'}]
text: Very comfy place for brunch and early afternoon coffee. Friendly stuff and decent coffee

I&#39;m a bit torn about this place. <br><br>I basically fell in love with it via yelp reviews and photos before ever going. But upon visit I felt pretty let down.<br><br>The poached eggs and salmon on toast is the picture of my ideal breakfast. Thick toast, eggs, smoked salmon, hollandaise. In my mind it was delicious but in reality it was not. Realize I&#39;m really breaking away from the trend of the reviews here so perhaps it was just an issue with mine...<br><br>- the bread was hardly toasted and definitely not warm (consistency leads me to believe it was thrown in the microwave for a few seconds and then topped with the eggs and sauce, as the bread was tough and relatively hard to cut)<br><br>- the eggs were hardly warm <br><br>- the hollandaise sauce had a weirdly similar consistency to mayonnaise, and also was not warm<br><br>I&#39;m used to a breakfast dish such as this being served relatively hot, so &#34;hardly warm&#34; is rather unpleasant. No one likes warm (soon-to-be-cold) eggs.<br><br>Usually in an eggs bene I am using the bread / muffin to soak up every last bit of the hollandaise, but in this instance I found myself scraping most of it off. I&#39;ve never seen a hollandaise this consistency before, and I&#39;ve had my share of it elsewhere. It seems like they mixed something into it so the sauce could be made in bigger batches and stand to sit around without constant stirring. If you&#39;ve made hollandaise sauce before you know how temperamental it can be, and requires a lot of love and attention. Not mayo (or whatever additive was in there - it was not a pure egg/butter/lemon juice recipe). <br><br>I really really wanted to love this place. My food aside, the redeeming qualities I saw were..<br><br>- my friend&#39;s burger looked delicious<br><br>- the ambiance is very cute<br><br>- the beer list has some interesting options<br><br>- the rest of the menu dishes look promising<br><br>I&#39;m hopeful was just a fluke, and intend to give Group Therapy another chance, possibly for dinner. Unfortunately I&#39;m just not in a rush to go back. There are a lot of other great looking places in Duxton I&#39;d rather try first.

I only had scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, a cappuccino, a passion fruit tart, and an espresso. All were excellent and reasonably priced. The hours of this place are really weird, especially that most days they start serving breakfast at 11. It reminded me a lot of Jimmy Monkey, and the cappuccino in particular had almost identical flavor to theirs.<br><br>It&#39;s a little like they are trying too hard to be hipster, but I didn&#39;t really see anything to complain about, except the scrambled eggs were a little runnier than they are in America. I guess if you don&#39;t like your scrambled eggs runny, you should ask for them to be cooked more than usual. The food and coffee was great, especially the cappuccino and passion fruit tart.

One of fave lunch plc in tanjong pagar.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'One of fave lunch plc in tanjong pagar.'}]
text: one of my favourite cafe in singapore with their fabulous food and cuppa.<br>my fave would be the udon salad, egg w hollandaise sauce and they always have this couscous salad for their side dish which is very unique and yummy.<br>the down thing is it can be quite crowded and noisy during peak times and your hair can get smelly if you eat in there<br>.

The first impression of the place was good- relaxing,  casual ambience, lots of delicious-sounding food on the menu. It quickly went downhill from there. <br><br>My partner and I were seated at a table for four, nursing our drinks and conversing, when a waitress came up to us saying &#34;Excuse me, you&#39;re sharing this table with someone else.&#34; Those were her exact words. Now, I don&#39;t mind having to share my table with strangers if I had been warned of the possibility ahead of time and asked if I was ok with it. The way she put it was just insensitive. <br><br>The other couple sat down next to us and the 4 of us sat in awkward silence. The table was small and we were literally rubbing elbows with strangers. As soon as another table freed up, they requested to change tables. Barely 10 mins later, another waitress came up again and said &#34;Excuse me, another couple will be sitting at this table.&#34; For the second time, our conversation died down. It was getting very disruptive. This time, the two companions were not shy about talking out loud. The first thing we heard was:<br><br>A: &#34;How have you been?&#34;<br>B: &#34;I&#39;ve been sick lately.&#34;<br>A: &#34;Really? Me too.&#34;<br><br>Needless to say,  we spent the rest of our meal in silence, focused on eating fast and getting out of there. Food was decadent - I had the Croque Madame. The bacon was great and cheese was abundant. But in Singapore, where people eat not just for sustenance but as a way to relax and socialize, this place barely even made it on my list of go-to places for brunch. The sad thing is, Group Therapy&#39;s intended vision was to be a place where people connect over food.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/xsSFENKAjwhTxOqmQhlw5g/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=l5RgAw3CrSU0HFLeUk5MKg&select=xsSFENKAjwhTxOqmQhlw5g', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zhsb5YOV0Vu4wx5z39B9xA/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=l5RgAw3CrSU0HFLeUk5MKg&select=zhsb5YOV0Vu4wx5z39B9xA', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Eggs with smoked salmon', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': 'Eggs with smoked salmon'}]
text: Group Therapy is located above Etna and it boasts a spacious interior- High ceilings, comfy sofas (albeit a little too close to the diner next to us). <br><br>GT does an all-day-breakfast even though the selection is quite small. I saw granola with yogurt and another dish together with Poached eggs with smoked salmon and hollandaise sauce. They also have other light bites like panini sandwiches, chicken ham pie, salads etc. There is also some simple main courses like a meat stew. W wasn&#39;t hungry so I only got to taste the Poached Egg. <br><br>Fluffy toasted white bread. Crispy and nice on the outside. Very similar to that of Wild Honey. Nicely poached and runny egg yolks. Salty smoked salmon which were slowly cooked by the warmth of the eggs that rested nicely on them. And that hollandaise sauce is so cheesy and creamy! I like that it&#39;s not too sour but the heaviness of the cream became a little too much halfway into the meal.<br><br>You gotta do the Brother&#39;s Toffee Apple Cider. Absolutely my favorite. :) Cider with brekkie? Anytime. :)

text: 45 minutes to get food. Eggs not done properly. Mediocre pancakes. Getting chased down for more money due to billing error - in most parts of the world you let that go if its your own damn fault, not chase customers for nickels and dimes. Such a lame place. Staff pleasant enough just the customer service and competence coming up short  and good needs to be better than mediocre.

text: Group Therapy Coffee has a nice, laid back vibe that puts you at ease almost immediately. Mis-matched furnitures, decorative pieces and crockery dots the spacious cafe. A twinge of vintage, a touch of rustic and a dose of randomness works to the cafe&#39;s aesthetic advantage. It&#39;s a place that makes you feel like anything goes - a pretty rare occurrence in this day and age.<br><br>Having been craving for a some egg benedict for quite some time now, I eagerly ordered a serving of poached eggs that came with smoked salmon, toast, gruyere cheese and hollandaise sauce ($15). Dessert is always a must, hence the lemon meringue tart ($6.50) and a cup of roasted almond latte ($6.50). <br><br>I felt that the food was quite pricey for the potion given, its taste was decent but nothing spectacular. The eggs were nicely poached but the thick slice of toast sitting underneath it was a little too hard and dry. Fortunately, the runny yolk saved it from being too bad. I couldn&#39;t taste the gruyere cheese and actually forgot that it was part of the dish until I began writing this a few minutes ago. I&#39;m now thinking they might have forgotten to put the cheese in but oh well.<br><br>The lemon meringue tart was not bad, bursting with flavour with a tangy custard, coupled with a sweet meringue top. The only complaint was that the meringue was a little soggy, but I liked that the custard was filled with real lemon zest, that gave it a nice bite. <br><br>The next time I need an escape from demands/datelines/work, I have a place to run to for some respite and perhaps some much needed therapy. Food or desserts aren&#39;t exactly their forte but a place like that, with its quirkiness, ought not to be overlooked. It&#39;s a pretty great place, whether for a meet-up with the girlfriends, or for chilling alone with a book. Just try not to go there hungry I guess?

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/VlhPVM9S4xsDFiUupFlFbQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=UNW0knLInvlu_f0ysX9K3A&select=VlhPVM9S4xsDFiUupFlFbQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Bvsi_JzEzFOZMcoF-3nN0A/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=UNW0knLInvlu_f0ysX9K3A&select=Bvsi_JzEzFOZMcoF-3nN0A', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hBFWWM2tvn7Kt9jnYmwZnw/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=UNW0knLInvlu_f0ysX9K3A&select=hBFWWM2tvn7Kt9jnYmwZnw', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}]
text: Hidden on the second floor along Duxton road, Group Therapy is a must-visit for brunch and coffee lovers looking for a relaxing space.<br><br>The ambience is fantastic. It&#39;s neither too hot nor cold, and there is lots of bright natural light pouring in from the large windows. It feels cozy, and I can imagine spending a whole day here with coffee and a book.<br><br>And for some reason, it&#39;s never crowded whenever I visited, which makes me believe that this place is still underrated compared to the other popular brunch hang-outs.<br><br>The Eggs Benedict I ordered were served with marvellous hollandaise sauce. It&#39;s served on hot toasted bread, which helps to catch the runny yolk so they don&#39;t escape from your mouth!<br><br>Also must-try: the waffles.

Everything about this café is what brunch should be. Somewhat hidden in a second floor, after climbing a somewhat sketchy staircase, one enters a space reminiscent of something out of Boston&#39;s beacon street. With it&#39;s high ceilings and very home-y feel, one finds a table to indulge in the classics: be it a nice sandwich or indulging in a delicious Belgian waffle, ice cream [not] optional.  Coffee, ironically, is pretty ordinary, but the food and ambiance more than make up for it. It&#39;s the kind of place that transports you from Singapore, and makes you want to spend the entire afternoon nursing that hangover from last night while not-so-guiltily indulging. Don&#39;t be selfish though, pack up and get moving soon, as many other enthusiastic brunchers are waiting for your spot!

text: Good vibe, friendly service. I had the pumpkin waffle with poached eggs, and guacamole on the side, really tasty. Only comment is that waffle was too sweet, It would been fantastic if it had been savoury, I could only earlt half of it or else I&#39;d destroy the experience. Chocolate with coconut milk and 7-spice chai latte were delicious. <br>I can see myself coming back, I hope they consider fixing the pancake mix.

text: Came here for brunch with my husband and one of his friends since it&#39;s right around the corner from where we live. I had such a hard time deciding on what to eat.. I ended up ordering a plate of mini croissants with two sunny side up eggs. My husband ordered the peanut butter waffles with honey and no bananas. My order ended up coming with scrambled eggs so I was a little annoyed.. They took it back, fixed the egg situation but by then my croissants weren&#39;t as warm. I remember there was another issue as well but it&#39;s not coming to me. Anyways, the waffle was amazing, my eggs were good, the croissant was a bit cold. All in all a three star experience!

The good:  Ok, I didn&#39;t hate hate the place, but I&#39;m struggling to find something positive to say.  Not that it&#39;s the worst of the worst, but it&#39;s the worst of a growing trend of cafes that  think just because they can put eggs on a plate and designs in a latte that they are special and can charge a premium.  I do remember getting a tasty water.  Does that count?  <br><br>The bad:  Let&#39;s start with the food.  Below par at best.  I can cook better at home, confirmed.  Second is the atmosphere, I think training bra music was pumping the whole time, and the furniture is made up of Salvation Army leftovers.  Couches, high tops, tables, nothing goes together.  I think I saw a bike on the wall though...props for that.  My coffee was...forgettable.  Fully staffed, but I still had to air traffic control someone over when I wanted something.    <br><br>The ugly:  Not easy to find, full of students chatting it up or jamming out on their laptops.  I&#39;m really most upset about the food.  I ordered a eggs benedict and asked for ham.  They put bacon bits on my eggs.  Bacon bits people!

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=63h0-a7eRNhfBpHEfPctgQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/qqAvA6nKGfOooEpbeWdV_Q/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/qqAvA6nKGfOooEpbeWdV_Q/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/qqAvA6nKGfOooEpbeWdV_Q/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/qqAvA6nKGfOooEpbeWdV_Q/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/qqAvA6nKGfOooEpbeWdV_Q/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/qqAvA6nKGfOooEpbeWdV_Q/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Coco C.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Coco C.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=63h0-a7eRNhfBpHEfPctgQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 0, 'photoCount': None, 'reviewCount': 4, 'eliteYear': None}
text: I like this place, the looks of it, the wooden tables and the cosy atmosphere. I have been here for breakfast, and I love the muesli yoghurt, although I would prefer to have a non-sugar version but that you cannot find in Singapore, can you...<br><br>It is rather expensive, though, and opens very late. One morning I got there 20 min before they opened, and I was put off because I was not let in with my morning newspaper. You don&#39;t blame them, do you, but what harm could would it have done if I had sat quietly at a table reading my newspaper while they were opening up? It would have shown some entrepeneur spirit, and had made me feel valued. So I roamed the streets and got back as the first guest.<br><br>I do recommend this place.
Great place to get brunch and work for a few hours. Good coffee and good looking clientele.

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/VdcS35d-5o6-7kQGSy1dOw/300s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=YvX_IaRHHO_bd_yPMYgrbA&select=VdcS35d-5o6-7kQGSy1dOw', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. There&#39;s a respectable selection of craft beer here.', 'width': 300, 'height': 300, 'caption': "There's a respectable selection of craft beer here."}]
text: A better than average place for brunch. I really enjoyed the shepherd&#39;s pie, although it wasn&#39;t exactly what I was expecting. But I&#39;m always impressed when a place surprises me some decent beers on the menu. For a coffee shop, their craft beer and cider list was exceptional. It&#39;s not a bar, but if you&#39;re on Duxton Hill and craving a good beer, this is a good place to stop.

Great place to chill out with your friends and grab a cuppa coffee while you&#39;re at it. It&#39;s nestled in a cosy unit along Duxton Road, and the owners are really friendly and the service is pretty warm and welcoming.<br><br>Food wise, I came here for an event and we had the quiches, mango salad and some fish wrap sandwiches which were pretty yummy. <br><br>They have a private space which can be cordoned off so this is a good place for events as well.

I come here very often because along with the Pigeonhole, GT is a chilled out little place in Duxton Hill that is great for working out of. With fast wifi, good airconditioning and good seats, as well as good coffee, it is nice to be able to &#39;come home&#39; and sit down and jump into work and jump just as quickly into socializing as well.<br><br>I frequently schedule work meetings here as it&#39;s central and a good place to be at, overall.<br><br>It&#39;s located on the upstairs unit of a typical Duxton shophouse. The decor is a nice mix of industrial and warm coziness, and the owners and baristas and waitstaff super friendly and inviting.<br><br>The wine and beer list is also above average for a cafe of this type. They certainly know what they are drinking!<br><br>The space is also available for events in the evenings.

userinfo: {'link': '/user_details?userid=OID9ZOyljsyx7HVAP_29aQ', 'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/60s.jpg', 'srcSet': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/ms.jpg 1.67x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/120s.jpg 2.00x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/90s.jpg 1.50x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/168s.jpg 2.80x,https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/photo/wNpKlX9uvhD0o7-P7sitrQ/180s.jpg 3.00x', 'markupDisplayName': 'Ai Lin M.', 'displayLocation': 'Singapore, Singapore', 'altText': 'Ai Lin M.', 'userUrl': '/user_details?userid=OID9ZOyljsyx7HVAP_29aQ', 'partnerAlias': None, 'friendCount': 7, 'photoCount': 180, 'reviewCount': 180, 'eliteYear': None}
text: We were on the prowl not just for a great place for brunch, but one that served amazing poached eggs. After some research, we decided to head to Group Therapy and, boy, we were not at all disappointed with this choice. <br><br>The poached eggs were absolutely delicious - served atop a thick slice of toast and smothered with a hearty, creamy hollandaise sauce. My only regret is that my partner and I ordered one each, which proved to be way too much for us because the portion was so generous. I suggest sharing one and getting something lighter for your second selection. <br><br>It&#39;s casual, yet is evidently on the hipster&#39;s radar, so expect crowds, especially on the weekends.

Rightfully named and living up to it, Group Therapy Café offers group-counseling sessions, but in this case the shrinks are your friends (and maybe a slice of yummy carrot cake or a freshly brewed cuppa served by their cordial, jolly baristas!). <br><br>It might a tad bit ominous at first with a &#39;GROUP THERAPY upstairs&#39; greeting you as you enter a dark, narrow staircase, keep going towards the light at the end of the tunnel and you&#39;ll be impressed. Group Therapy was brightly sun-lit and complete with the tinkering of teacups and the aroma of freshly brewed coffee accompanied with the muffled chatter of bosom buddies.<br><br>The ambience is perfect - having been here on 4 separate occasions - loving it each and every time, each corner promises a different experience. There were many different sets of furniture, fit for the odd group of 5 or if it&#39;s just a corner for one, there&#39;ll be one waiting for you!

photos: [{'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/y1Dkx2L3ErGKyuZVOIg35g/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=YBbPOXIAOgkkuS3dqYy2Ug&select=y1Dkx2L3ErGKyuZVOIg35g', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/pKC2ZwDzsF1BfpPSKsUgMQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=YBbPOXIAOgkkuS3dqYy2Ug&select=pKC2ZwDzsF1BfpPSKsUgMQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/u97Q6u-IMzal8mUwMkRvug/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=YBbPOXIAOgkkuS3dqYy2Ug&select=u97Q6u-IMzal8mUwMkRvug', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}, {'src': 'https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/57eSCrvGAqA5ZBiGwZ3saQ/180s.jpg', 'link': '/biz_photos/group-therapy-coffee-singapore?reviewid=YBbPOXIAOgkkuS3dqYy2Ug&select=57eSCrvGAqA5ZBiGwZ3saQ', 'altText': 'Photo of Group Therapy Coffee - Singapore, Singapore', 'width': 180, 'height': 180, 'caption': ''}]
text: I&#39;ll be upfront here - I&#39;m a total Group Therapy fan. From their hipster decor, to the yummy toasted almond latte, to the wonderfully sinful poached eggs, Group Therapy ticks all the boxes that a cafe should be. Nestled in the hip Duxton area, Group Therapy&#39;s entrance is rather hidden away, with only a signboard outside giving any indication of its location. But once you find the place, man, it&#39;s easy to while hours away there - people watching, or just hanging out with friends. And should you decide to go to this cafe - really, trust me. The poached eggs are to die for.

text: A nice little cafe. It isn&#39;t along the line of star hacks and the like where you order, wait for your coffee and no one bothers with you.<br>I went with the thoughts it is like that.
